Title: I tried. I really really tried to like it. It was a torture.
Review:
On paper this movie had all the ingredients to be amazing: Michelle Yeoh, Jammie Lee Curtis, wacky Sci-Fi alternate reality, comedy, drama and kung fu. What the hell happen?!!!

This movie was a pain to watch! I watched it in little 15 minutes portions. More than 15 minutes and my brain started hurting. It took me about a week to finish it.

The movie was annoying. Torture. I could not handle it.

The story was over the top silly ridiculous. The dialogs cringe worthy. In my point of view the movie was poorly directed.

The movie has some moments of creativity but they get destroyed by the dialogs.

Even the fighting sequences of this movie felt off. I found them boring generic.

I have been watching Michelle Yeoh movies since the 80's. I hate to say that this movie is not one of her bests.

Title: Too much ALL at Once!
Review:
While I'm a big fan of actresses Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis I was excited to see them both in the same film.. I clapped when I saw Jamie's first screen-- what a treat!! I'm late with my review and I'm pleased that the results are in and there is an Oscar Buzz, but the movie was wayyyy too busy for my brain to digest.. I reviewed the great reviews so I was even more anxious to check this film-unfortunately to me-- It appears many are simply deers herding of a cliff.. I've come to believe many are not comfortable being the negative voice.. I'm comfortable in my skin and I must say- the film is insanely busy- the concept is allllll over the place-- but so are we, so I'm certain most can relate to our own noise.

Title: A disastrous movie
Review:
After I managed to stay awake for 40 minutes, I can only say that this is an awful movie in which everything and anything was thrown. It's like watching Jackie Chan movies, but hyped up to the point of exhaustion. I don't know how this movie could have won an Oscar at all except possibly for special effects. But the Oscar award is of dubious quality anyway, as is, for example, the Eurosong in the world of music. This large number of won Oscars might have been intended to flatter the Chinese population (we know that films featuring oppressed minorities, disabled people, sensitive groups of all profiles are preferred at the Oscars...). But who knows, maybe the other 99 minutes of movie surpassed even classics like Citizen Kane, Apocalypse Now, The Godfather, Rashomon, Pulp Fiction, The Last Emperor...

Title: Waste of time
Review:
This film should not have been nominated for an Academy Award.

It's just not worth time and efforts to watch this. The number of negative reviews of real people indicates the real attitude of the audience.

It's emotionally empty. I felt no joy, no pity, no empathy for the actors. Only paused a few times to check how much pain left.

I will never recommend to watch this film for my friends or relatives.

The only purpose to watch this film is to understand the degree of degradation of modern film industry - scraps of contrived meanings, mediocre actings and visual trash.

Stop this absurd, respect the audience.

Title: foolish jumble of nonsense & ugh the mustard
Review:
What a steaming heap of garbage. The acting was just ok. The script was 50% a kooky pastiche of martial arts films, comic universe action, and vulgar puns that lent no help to the story. The other half took a basic family conflict theme and over-inflated the story so it became permanent victim-status silliness. Vague trite platitudinal dialogue made me so bored. When the first third of the movie ended i was hoping that was the whole move but no, there were two more parts to slog through. I am glad i only spent $5 on my ticket and i don't think this is even something you'd want to rent or watch on tv for free some day. Avoid.

It reminds me of the Terry Gilliam movies of old that were critically acclaimed but unwatchable. There is nothing of any substance in this movie that is worth watching. Michelle Yeoh is nominated for an Oscar in a movie in which she doesn't even really act. She stands there exhausted while the chaos of the scene surrounds her. Last night I also watched Women Talking and was amazed at how unsung that movie is right now. EEAAO will probably win but in a few months the people who thought it was so great will be asking what the hell were they thinking.

Title: Confusing and a little stupid
Review:
Maybe it's just me, but I got lost as soon as the other dimension or whatever kicked in. It just didn't make any sense to me, And up to that point, the story did not engage me - the frantic goings-on at a family-run laundromat, and an IRS audit conducted by a character played by Jamie Lee Curtis made to look frumpier than ever. I really didn't care for the characters, and I figured out pretty quickly that I didn't care what was happening to the lead actor; thus, my wife and I agreed we needed to find something else to watch. Can't figure out why this was a best picture nominee: perhaps it's because The Academy now nominates more that just five motion pictures each year. As a result, they dig deeper in the barrel and dredge out a few iffy choices. This definitely is one of those.

Title: Michelle Yeoh's worst movie.
Review:
This film is poor in every respect. The script, the direction, the pace, the story, the effects and yes, even the acting. It can only be the product of hyping as it is so bad. It makes The Samaritan look like a good movie, that's how terrible it is. Title: Nonsense, but not in a good way
Review:
What a load of tedious rubbish. A ridiculous film with a stupid plot that made no sense.

I had heard it was bad, but thought, given all the Oscars, it must have something going for it. Looking at what it won, I'll agree with the editing award and Jamie Lee Curtis's supporting actress award (although Shephanie Hsu was also very deserving). But best film? Definitely not. Best director? Not so much. Best actor for Michelle Yeoh (who I really like, but she's been in far better films than this)? Best supporting actor for Ke Huy Quan? No, sorry, I don't get it at all, it was just a solid performance, nothing outstanding.

All Quiet on the Western Front was, in pretty much every way, a far superior film. Plus, it made sense.

So anyway, I started watching it and was vaguely intrigued. But then it got stupid and I soon lost interest, eventually willing it to finish. Yes, some of the fight sequences were quite good, I suppose, but given that none of the characters was believable, I didn't really care about the outcome. In the end, it was like, oh no, not another fight sequence; I'm just not interested anymore.

I accept a lot of effort clearly went into the film, but it is, I fear, misplaced effort. The costumes and props were comical, but again, not in a good way, and not in a way that made the film more believable or endearing. And the bagel and the hot dogs... What were they about?! Were they supposed to be funny? Stupid is not the same as funny.

Title: Lost The Will To Live After 30 mins!
Review:
I really can't see what the hype is all about. And neither could the BAFTAS voters apparently. It remains to be see what The Oscars will bring...... Definitely style over substance, I really did try to like it but frankly I thought it was a mess, it wore me out, constantly jumping back and forth, and yes I know that's what the plot was all about but really?

There are SO many better movies, & as for Michelle Yeoh's nomination for best actress? Nominate Olivia Colman for Empire of Light, now that is a phenominal movie! Jamie Lee Curtis was miscast in my opinion but what do I know? Just proves what poor judges much of the cinema going public are!

Title: One of the worst highly rated movies I've ever seen
Review:
The first 10 minutes set the scene with relatively unintelligible dialog, no clues as to plot, and uninspired scenery and cinematography. The plot, when it eventually appears, vaguely, about halfway through the movie, is weird, even for this die hard sci fi fan. The frenetic scenes, poor dialogs, unrelatable characters, truly ho hum cinematography and costumes and makeup and sounds, made this unbearable to watch. I watched 2/3 and then fell asleep. Only potential positive for me was lead actress acting but that was overwhelmed by the film. To be so highly rated I guess this movie contains some technical aspects that professional reviewers appreciated but to me as a viewer, the plot, dialog, costuming, scenery, and characters made it very unentertaining.

Title: This won how many awards?
Review:
This movie is beyond bizarre and not in the intriguing, worth-your-time sort of bizarre way. From early on all the way to the ending it's confusing as can be and I'm convinced no one really knows what's going on, including the writers themselves. The scenes are all over the place, starting with a heavy sense of seriousness only turning into one of the most ridiculous, over-the-top and obnoxious films I've ever seen. Comedy film, you say? What's that? Because this isn't it. The amount of twists and turns this film takes of highly unpredictable scenes in the most underwhelming and uninteresting (but loud) way possible is almost annoying. If a movie was "try-hard" - this would be it.

Title: In what world is this a good movie?
Review:
The rave reviews, the Oscars... There are surely more meaningful and thought-provoking movies that were made in 2022, were there not?

The movie is an incomprehensible jumble of martial arts stunts and random special effects, severely lacking a storyline (because the action always jumps laterally, and that's intentional) or meaning. For those patient enough to sit through the first (excruciatingly senseless) one hour and 45 minutes, some meaning may start to emerge. I almost didn't make the cut to be in that group, I almost bailed out at the one hour mark (that's how much I normally give films to start becoming interesting or meaningful). But being an Oscar winning film, I made an exception.

After the senseless setup, most of which should have ended up on the edit room floor, a message starts to emerge. The message is pretty trite and far from revolutionary. The movie does take the crown in one category in my opinion, that of "the most disappointing movie of the year". Especially when considering the hype to value ratio. Very disappointing.

Title: Crazy but not in a good way
Review:
Yes, this movie is really crazy. It's like nothing I have ever seen. But it is crazy in a bad way, so I'm really surprised that it has such high rating and good reviews.

First 30 minutes are quite interesting. Together with the main character we learn what is happening. I like that. I like when ordinary people are show in extraordinary circumstances. But that's it. Those extraordinary events quickly become annoying and watching that becomes tiresome. Movie is to long and repetitive. There also some cringe jokes like big d-s used to smack someone or b-plugs used to induce superpowers. College humour. Movie tries to pass some family values, but doing this in such crazy way didn't work for me at all.

Title: Rotten ideas
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: Just because you can, doesn't mean you should
Review:
The underlying message in this film is great; that no matter what choices you make or what path you choose in life, all that matters is love, hope, and kindness. But the execution of that message in EEAAO was chaotic, violent, and just plain painful to watch. Imagine being in a well-stocked kitchen preparing a huge pot of everything in the pantry and fridge. Everything. Just open every damn can, jar, bottle, carton, package, spice, and dump it all in the pot; flavors you like, and flavors that you find horribly distasteful. Dinner guests would likely find the concept unique, but would not likely find the dish itself palatable. That is my take in this film. Far too much for far too long. The 3 stars are for acting, otherwise I'd give this a very reluctant 1 star (only because I can't give zero).

Title: A great concept reduced to millennial angst, empty spectacle and Hallmark emotions
Review:
Really, there is very little going on here - the film starts with a fantastic high concept and likeable protagonists, but squanders this almost from the get-go. The film's multiverse is in practice just a set of gimmicks, and isn't used in any insightful or interesting way that informs the characters - the conflict between Evelyn and her daughter is banal in the extreme and there are no real thoughts here other than #BeKind and love each other. The film's hyperkineticism and forced wackiness is hiding the fact that there's basically no content here. And the character of the daughter is really underdeveloped, we know almost nothing about her - the film's central conflict would have worked way better if Joy had been more rounded and developed as a character.

Title: All over the place, from start to finish
Review:
I don't know which was the most embarrassing - the google eyes or the rocks.

The whole thing felt like it had been been thrown together by a bunch of 17-year-olds enjoying their first few puffs, falling about laughing at their own genius and 'innovation' (let's *do* it!) without a grownup in the room to say 'hang on a sec chaps'.

Can anyone tell me what would have been lost from this movie if, say, the amount of time given over to CGI martial arts was cut by 90%. Anyone? Characterisation? Plot development? Emotional engagement? Anything?

And what was the point? What was the great message of this movie? That the choices we make set our lives on one path out of an infinite number of possibilities. Wow! Profound, dood. Anything else, after two hours and 20 minutes of my life? Er, no. That's yer lot mate.

How the hell did this hoover up acting oscars? No-one got a chance to act. I'm going to go out on a limb here and say that you can only have great acting in a great movie. Where, in this, did anyone get the chance? At what point in the movie was great acting required? To show....what? Love? Hate? Hurt? Resentment? Determination? What? When did any of the characters exhibit anything beyond mild bemusement or yet another display of CGI martial arts.

I am so old I believe that at its heart moviemaking is storytelling. This had no story. None at all. No beginning, no middle, no end. Nothing.

I suppose fans of this kind of 'innovation' might see the likes of me as like old school jazz aficionados faced with freeform and bebop and exciting rule breaking experimentations, and not getting it. That's their prerogative. But this isn't exciting innovation. This isn't freeform jazz. It's just noise; and it goes on for two hours 20 minutes.

In 10 years time - no, in five years time - nobody will remember this movie at all other than one of the all time 'years the academy really lost its mind'.

Nobody will watch it.

Nobody will archive it.

Nobody will reference it, and it will haunt nobody's dreams. I can barely remember anything about it now, and I only saw it last night.

Only a corrupt culture which has lost all confidence in itself could elevate this worthless, depthless, shapeless mess to any kind of position, hold it in any kind of regard. I've seen some off Academy decisions in my time, but nothing close to this.

Rubbish produced by over-indulged rank amateurs. Nul points. The Academy should hang its head in shame.

Title: Nothing Anywhere Ever
Review:
The Academy Awards has lost its way. This movie was the last straw in giving any credence to their idea of best picture of the year. This movie was pointless, stupid, and worse than a complete waste of time. I am embarrassed that I hung in for the finish. Although I must say I was very happy to see the final words "the end." I am still numb from trying to figure out the point. I believe if this was a film student's first attempt at a movie the professor would kindly nudge him into a different career path. I would like to explain what this movie is all about but I have absolutely no idea. Do yourself a favor and do not watch this film.

Title: Great potential and Great failure.
Review:
Pros:
You will never see another movie like this.


Insanely creative imaginative complex beautiful
visually stunning
Mind opening scientific ideas
Great Acting
Great Directing


Cons:


What do I mean? The audience is left shorthanded in the end behind every great scene, every great sci-fi idea, every great action, the answer to "why is this happening?" is always insubstantial and frankly dumb.

If I could sum up this movie in one metaphorical sentence: It's like buying a five star restaurant then finding out it's filled with incompetent garbage chefs. So does that really make the restaurant five star or garbage? Isn't a restaurant as good as its chefs? Just like isn't a movie as good as its message? Hence my rating.

If I could sum up this movie in one literal sentence it would be: Asserting the idea that the infinite Cosmos, and infinite possibility of our existence, all of life and all of the Creation, all the time effort energy matter was all made for the sole purpose of advancing the United State's leftist political agenda. (And no I am not left nor right nor even an american nor do I take any solid position in anything. I'm just a human observer watching a movie. Resist the urge ti put me in a box lol)

I mean the literal quote they use in the ending of the movie and throughout is "nothing matters". It's as if they are only looking at the chaotic part of all Creation but forgetting to also see the orderly part of all Creation. I mean creation is both chaotic and orderly at the same time. And saying things like "Be kind especially when you don't know what's going on". Well if you don't know what's going on then shouldn't you be neither kind nor mean. Your assuming kindness is always answered with kindness. That is equally as dumb as assuming unkindness is always answered in unkindness.

This movie wants to pretend it is being open minded when really it is just taking an extremist position just like any other boring bias movie. It had so much potential...that's what will disappoint you the most.

Title: They should have to pay you to watch this movie
Review:
My wife and I went to this movie based on the numerous reviews which heaped mountains of praise on it. The movie was a dystopian nightmare. We have loved Michelle Yeoh in almost every movie we have seen her in, but her prodigious talents were wasted in a movie with a plot that could have been written by an articulate three year old. I think I read somewhere that a movie is supposed to have a plot or story line. The few amusing segments were not enough to make the movie worth sitting through. In my opinion people who sat through the entire travesty should not only receive a refund, but should have been paid for enduring the unbearable experience.

Title: It's official. Marvel has ruined Hollywood.
Review:
Do you know that famous Bender quote from Futurama? "Oh yeah, well I'm gonna make my own theme park... with black jack... and hookers... in fact, forget the park". Now remember what Scorsese said about Marvel movies and imagine A24 said the same thing when they saw MCU's success.

All the great Hollywood directors and actors all the way back to Christopher Reeve and Orson Welles warned us this would happen. For the better half of cinema's history we were warned that cynical unoriginal uninspired entertainment is gonna take over the business.

The Oscars were never about quality, everyone knows this. But an academy award winning film is often AT LEAST palatable.

The only thing this movie does well is choreography. Pacing is awful. Story is awful. Full of plot holes that I guess could be explained with the mother of all plot hole plugs - THE MULTIVERSE. Nowadays whenever a movie struggles to tie its own shoelaces, it's explained away with the multiverse. A24 was supposed to be an alternative to MCU, not a victim to it.

Acting isn't great either. The script is awful. The entire premise feels randomly generated by an AI and then the writers just slapped in some tumblr posts about rocks with googly eyes talking about the meaninglessness of life on a cliff. This is cynical and insulting. Nothing happens in this movie. Just a bunch of people beating each other up and then loving each other.

I carry a deep and ugly hatred in my heart for all the garbage that came out of the MCU, but at least they were somewhat original compared to this. Why should an innocent viewer be forced to inflict as serious a brain damage as to waste two and a half hours on this pointless is beyond me. I don't even know how I was forced to endure this torture.

Title: Must be a meme
Review:
I feel like this film must have been generated by some sort of algorithmic AI optimized to generate meme content. Is it concerning that the most relatable scenes were the ones of the two anthropomorphized rocks overlooking a canyon?

I guess the film stood as a symbol of one of its key themes: that nothing seems to make sense anymore. I bet in 60 or 100 years, should we make it that far, people will look back with a mix of pity and utter confusion and wonder: how did this qualify as a work of art, let alone one that people lined up to see? Let alone one that was acclaimed by the Academy Awards?? Sort of like how we look back at Dadaism or something.

I don't think it's a stretch to say that all of the characters were quite sad and pathetic. I guess the message at the end was: be kind to each other, despite how confused we might all be. That's great, but I'm not sure why I needed to spend my Friday evening sitting through hours of middle-school antics to get there.

I won't give it a zero because it's not a terrible film, but it just feels bewildering and not in an enlightening way. Maybe it's how the robots will look at the people in the future: what are these weird and dumb humans doing? I don't know.

In any case, there is one thing with which I will take issue: the core thesis that as there are millions of alternate universes, in most of which we kill one another, and because life on this planet like the others is ultimately meaningless, we may as well at least enjoy our time here with one another and be mindful of the moment. Maybe that'll turn out to be true - who knows - but most likely it just reinforces quite a nihilist and dangerous attitude towards life. Yes, we should be good and nice - not as a coping strategy to get through a crappy life, but because our lives are precious and it's all we have.

Title: Multiverse - An infinite number, but this number didn't do it for me...
Review:
It was good to go to the cinema to watch something that is NOT another superhero movie, but this one straddles somewhere in the parody/homage aisle in between genres.

The problem is though that this film was really not made for me I think but a different audience. The only good thing I liked about this movie was the ever wonderful Michell Yeoh, but the rest left me cold. It will definitely fit a certain audience with it's off-beat humour and multiple Easter eggs.

However, I just wanted something that would grip me, but it might endear itself more to a female audience. That's not to say there isn't enough in it to make males enjoy it too. It's just a bit overlong and you'll either go with the ride or just want to get off. It didn't really add anything new to the increasingly parodied multiverse idea (e.g. Family Guy has done it to death now), but who cares?

For some I'd take a read of the reviews before watching it. It will be one that will find a cult audience in the same way that other left-field movies (like Scott Pilgrim) have over the years. Just wasn't for me sadly.

Title: Was whoever made this on drugs?
Review:
I found this was a bit too much for me. Too much jumping around and hard to keep up with what was supposed to be going on. It felt like whoever made this was high on drugs or perhaps it's more enjoyable to watch if you are high on drugs.

I don't really understand the hype about this particular film and why it won so many oscars. There were so many other better contenders!

On a positive note some of the themes are interesting and thought provoking but unfortunately the chaos of the whole movie put me off a bit. Perhaps if it had been slightly less random and chaotic I would have enjoyed it more.

Title: A waste of my time, even on second thought
Review:
I don't usually write reviews, and even less often when it is so little that I think of a movie. I am making an exception here. The message (love, acceptance, etc.) that the makers of this movie were so intent on conveying is pretty much undermined by the clich√©s that I saw here giftwrapped. Nothing matters is a quote from the movie. And they're right. None of this. Not even this movie. And my opinion either. Yet I felt it necessary to voice my feelings.

The heroine having a miserable life with shortcomings everywhere, yet deciding not to have it any other way. Well, it is a bit implausible, ridiculous even, don't you think? The actors in the leading roles did an OK job here, hence my 2 star rating. As for the path the director has chosen with special respect to the sudden switches, CGI and all, I must say it has failed to raise, let alone maintain my interest in the movie. It has failed to induce in me genuine empathy towards the characters. I couldn't relate. It's very rare that I can't. It seems to me that the director and whoever gave it a green light have lost sight of what cinema is about. This movie is in a paralell universe trapped and overrated. I do not recommend it.

Title: Boring, pointless, and massively overhyped movie.
Review:
I went to watch this movie expecting an interesting and quirky sci-fi movie. After all, it had won lots of Oscars, so it must be good, right?

What I got was a boring, confusing, and largely pointless mess.

And the ending seemed to suddenly jump tracks from one explanation of what was happening to a completely different one. It wasn't like it was a great twist like some movies have, it was more of a "we tricked you, ha!" change in direction.

I'm now questioning all the 9 and 10 star reviews here. Are they fake? Or are some of them from people that just want to ride the "me too" train because they don't want to admit they didn't like it and didn't understand it?

As for the Academy Awards, what are these people thinking? Clearly they can no longer be trusted to judge a movie based on what has appeal to the general public, rendering themselves redundant.

Title: The movie everyone pretends they liked
Review:
I really wanted to like it, but sorry, I just can't.

First, the movie wants to be as original as possible but loses any depth on the way. It wants to be funny but the level of humor is so primitive and vulgar, it just makes you roll your eyes over and over. After they deliver a joke, they will make sure to explain and repeat it as many times as possible, because they're sure their audience is dumb.

I would've given a star for their makeup and costumes, but it's so artificial and out of place, it feels like the movie was too boring and they just robed a neerby drag queen store.

One star is for the main actress' performance and the second one is also for her performance, because there's nothing else in this movie.
18 out of 28 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: A disaster ......
Review:
Should have stopped watching this mess after first 10 minutes but I watched to the boring meaningless end. I guess I waited for something of interest ... nope. Hoped to see a film worthy of Jamie Curtis ..... disappointing. I am a fan of time travel and sci-fi films this was awful.

Special effects were great but story was all over the place, no plot that could be followed. Film had a few moments of humor the martial arts choreographing was a disaster. Mostly contained about two hours of pointless, tasteless, plotless, disastrous idiocy.

Skip this for something better, glad I didn't see in a theater I would have walked out.
17 out of 28 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Cinematic Chinese Water Torture
Review:
Gave it two stars only because the acting was good, the special effects were impressive, and it had one or two funny moments. Otherwise, this incoherent, over-the-top, pretentious, and sloppily sentimental abortion would have shared space in my personal Hell with James Cameron's "Titanic," as the worst cinematic experience I have ever endured. If for some reason you feel compelled to waste two hours of your life you will never get back, resist the temptation to watch this thing and hit yourself in the head with a hammer, instead. You'll get the same mind-numbing after-effect while being blissfully unconscious, rather than having to suffer through more than 2-hours of sheer dreck.
14 out of 23 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Pretentious film with a confusing plot. Visual effects are peculiar and well made.
Review:
I was very curious to watch this A24 movie. Over the course of the last few months I saw that "Everything Everywhere All At Once" was praised a lot online. Unfortunately I was quite disappointed: aside from the peculiar visual effects and the compelling photography, the plot is almost non-existent. The story is confusing, the director tried to explain to the audience how the multiverses works in this narrative, but he failed to deliver a convincing exposure. By the end I wondered what was even the point of these almost two and a half hours that I dedicated to watching this mess. Some might say that there is a hidden message to this story, but I could not find it. There are a few genuinely funny scenes, but overall for me this was quite a tedious experience: this production is way too long for what it is and there are a lot of repetitive sequences that could be removed completely from the final cut. The cast did overall a good job, Stephanie Hsu and Michelle Yeoh were amazing in their acting, even though the characters they played were basically empty shells with little to no development.

Personally I think that this was a very ambitious project, but the production required more work on the writing and editing side. This production is way too complicated, it needed to be simplified in order to make the movie more digestible for the audience. A24 productions are a hit or miss, this is definitely a miss, but I appreciate the effort in trying to make a good sci-fi movie, having a more limited budget, compared to a Hollywood company.

Title: You can't trust IMDB ratings any more
Review:
Imagine a bunch of really annoying characters living that very busy life where non stop random rubbish happens to them all the time, I mean people constantly try to talk to them, they need a ton of random stuff get done and it's never ending, then suddenly add a sci fi "let's do a multiverse" gimmick...The story is pretty boring, the realisation is pretty average, my only guess someone is testing a ratingbot on IMDB...
15 out of 30 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Not so good as rumored
Review:
Not what I personally expected and an unreasonably hyped movie.

If you tend to be a superficial and self-centred person who's seeking to enlarge his vision without too much effort, this is the type of movie you're looking for.

Sometimes it gets funny and sometimes tedious.

The nowadays tendency to bring out the multiverse concept in movies is getting a bit out of hand and this one looks ridiculus in this aspect.

Many concepts are not even explained and most of the time get enphasised with banal explanations.

Overall not so good and too long.

Objectively speaking, not an Oscar Movie as one would expect.

Title: Really not a hater at all
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: Overhyped
Review:
Was looking forward to this movie after reading the reviews. Some good scenes and unique techniques but pretty boring storyline. Not sure what everyone is raving about.
27 out of 36 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.

Title: Juvenile, shallow and at times just plain disgusting
Review:
Playing along the lines of the Multiverse theme, we are obviously living in a universe where a movie as bad as Everything Everywhere All at Once can win 7 Oscars. So somewhere out there, there's a universe where this movie was a total box office flop. I must living in the wrong universe!

Seriously this is a rubbish movie. I cannot understand how anyone could rate this as the best movie ever. Poorly scripted, badly edited, and mindless drivel ... there were plot lines that went nowhere. Some scenes ran on forever and had little to do with the story line. How does an oversized burnt donut represent some form of deity?

Save your money and don't bother seeing this movie. You'll be doing yourself a big favour.

Title: A shiny object underneath your car except, oh wait, its just aluminum foil.
Review:
Pretentious ham-fisted nonsense for shallow minded movie-goers. Physically painfully random yet somehow completely contrived. "I'm 13 and this is deep" the movie.

I have only walked out of one movie in my entire life and I was incredibly tempted to walk out of this one. I only stayed because I was with friends. It was excruciatingly long. Paper thin plot taped together with an absolute barrage of jump cuts and flashing images. Two hours felt like three and a half. Completely exasperating and I couldn't wait for it to be over.

Actors tried their best but ultimately they had such little to work with (as far as an actual script), everything was so random, and there was so little character development that by the end I had virtually zero investment and couldn't care less about any of them.

Save your money and time. This one is a polished turd presented as a diamond in the rough. Drivel for the mindless masses.

Title: So overhyped but what a waste
Review:
I know it's a cliche, but seriously, that's over 2 hours of flashy crummy weirdness that I'll never get back. I think something is wrong with Hollywood when they try to sell us on such an oddball movie being worthy of winning awards.

I won't include any spoilers to ruin it for those brave enough to still give this one a shot. But I will say that it just fails to deliver on all of the hype that has followed this movie. I certainly followed the plot and all of the ensuing twists and turns. But it was just too high on the weird scale, and not enough grounding to make it truly enjoyable. My apologies to others who really loved this, but I just didn't get it, and I'd encourage anyone else considering this to just take a pass. Sorry.

Title: Unbelievable bad
Review:
It is a very long time ago when I turned off a movie but this one is so boring, confusing and annoying that I couldn't bear it to the end. I am so irritated about the majority of positive reviews that I am urged to write my first one here. Yes the actors are doing quite a good job but the plot is so absurd that I cannot understand why people like this. The movie doesn't manage to create any suspense but awkward and stressful scenes. Unfortunately it is another example why Oscar winning movies often are brackish. I don't know if I ever gave just 1 star but in this case my dissapointment in combination with the weirdness of this artwork couldn' t have another result. What a torture!
17 out of 23 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Craziest Plot Ever
Review:
This movie's plot is the most insane and ludicrous thing ever. It makes absolutely no sense of any kind. It is trying to be like the Matrix and not succeeding at all. The multiverse concept has been done many times in Marvel so it's not new. I can't believe this movie got 11 Oscar nominations. The Academy will nominate any garbage movie nowadays. This movie is a stew of randomness that just makes me sick to my stomach. It is convoluted to the point of no return. I am getting really tired of Hollywood making trash and people looking at it like it's gold. I have a need for movies to make some sense even if it's fantasy or science fiction.

Title: Way to overrated
Review:
Its your typical kung fu action fighting movie, after everything good is removed from it. Not really a sci fi movie, not a good story, no good drama, no comedy.

Basically an action movie with weird bizarre non sensical stuff, even the serious sections of the movie seem like a lame joke.

Title: Nothing, nowhere
Review:
Poor, vulgar, and has nothing. It is just a bad showoff that makers wanted to induce a deep meaning, but in reality there is nothing behind it. What do they even wanted to condemn? Fast bureaucratic modern life? Traditional believes? ... .

The film is so poor that even cannot bring a good martial arts not a good comedy and not even a mid level Sci-fi.

The acts are even worse than a soap opera.

I think Oscar just wanted to draw a line here by giving so many awards to this film. They wanted to show that box-office is more important that we dont even give a damn about cinema and acting anymore and everything is political.

The worst award winning movie I have ever seen in my life.

Title: Exhausting & Pretentious üëéüëéüëéüëé
Review:
I am at a complete loss for words regarding the good reviews and praise. I just dont get it. I have never felt so irritated/annoyed watching a film. Constant obnoxious and chaotic fighting scenes w/ no breaks whatsoever. The actual characters and story were nowhere to be found so i turned it off and saved myself the headache. Pretentious bull****. I am genuinely concerned by how many people "love" this movie.

Title: Not for me...
Review:
On Oscar night, I was excited to see who would win and listen to all the speeches. I was happy for the people that won. I would watch the movie later that won an Oscar for Best Picture.

Did this movie really win 7 Oscars? Wow! It started off with a good storyline, then it got distorted (literally).

I watched the movie after the Oscars. Now, I understand Angela Basset's face. At first, I was disappointed that she didn't clap or smile for the winner. Now, I get it. I would've still clapped and smile. Lol

I love Jamie Lee Curtis, Ke Huy Quan, and Michelle Yeoh. They deserved the Oscar for their performances over time in the industry.

I hope they are enjoying their Oscar and will continue to receive movie offers that will bring them another Oscar.

Title: The worst movie ive ever watched in decades!!!
Review:
That movie is a complete disaster.. all over the place.. complete waste of time... "Jackass" deserves oscar more than that.. the only equally stupid movie i tried to watch but didnt manage more than 30 min that was "Into the woods" with Johny Depp, i watched that one to the end because i was hoping that something interesting will happen at some point but i was disappointed, If thats a oscar worthy movie then we should all start making movies and win some gold .. disappointed at its maxed level!! If i could rate it with 0 i would unfortunately 1 is the minimum! There was so many better movies that could've won the oscars instead of THAT!
30 out of 42 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: I Really Tried To Like It
Review:
Let me first start off by saying that I did not want to watch this movie. I saw the trailer, and it wasn't my thing, but I was outvoted so my family and I ended up watching it anyways. It was recommended to us from a friend who said that she and her daughter had watched it twice already. I don't know if we saw different movies, but I will definitely not be watching this again.

The acting wasn't bad. And the plot was definitely original, but poorly executed. I found myself completely lost within 10 minutes of starting it, and that never changed. They try to do so much without explaining any of it. I can see the idea, but I just did not understand this movie at all. It was all over the place, and I just kept checking the time to see how much was left, and that's not a sign of a good movie.

I tried to like it, to see what everyone else in the reviews was seeing, but I was so bored watching it and wanted to be doing anything else. The only reason we watched the whole thing through was because we spent money on it. So if you were considering renting this film but wanted to see the reviews first, if I were you, I wouldn't spend my time or my money on this film. Wish I had read the reviews before I rented it.

Title: Too long, too forced
Review:
I love weird movies. But this movie is just ... ok. The 8.x rating makes no sense.. it's just an unnecessarily long mish mash of random things added in just for the sake of being weird and then finally a heart strings pull at the end. Sounds very much like the director's own movie 'Swiss Army Man' but with more of Radcliffe's corpses. Feels like movies like this were made because the creatives are tripping and is also obligated to deliver preachy themes and forced pandering.
9 out of 15 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.

Title: Thought this would be a good movie because the Academy Awards...
Review:
I couldn't wait for it to be over. Totally confused and full of crude humor. I almost turned it off three times but was waiting for the reason why the Academy Awards said it was good but I guess I totally miss that part because it was like Bill and Ted meets Marvel Universe meets whatever other sick movie that they put stuff up their butts for fun. There were so many more better movies out there and I don't know why this one got all the awards, other then the fact that people don't know what a good movie is anymore. This is certainly not the best movie of the year. I would say it's one of the worst. The whale was 1000 better.

Title: No offense to the actors but quite unbearable to watch
Review:
No offense to Michelle Y and the rest of the actors but how did this film end up winning so many Oscar? The first 15 mins was kinda funny to watch, after that it went downhill fast where this fiction was introduced. I turned it off after the scene in the elevator where Kongfu started, it was unbearable. The movie is soulless. I wonder if this was heavily campaigned for Oscar awards due to so many recent incidences. Sorry, Cate Blanchette's movie is more interesting.

I watched it for free on Peacok after the Oscar but I could not get myself to finish the movie because it was pretty bad. Unbearable.

Title: Garbage
Review:
Utter rubbish nonsense all over the place. I don't get it, really I don't.

I saw it and I was hoping to see something interesting.

One of the main issues you had with the movie was its length, which was almost three hours. This is certainly a valid criticism, as long movies can be difficult to sit through, especially if the pacing is slow.

Another problem you had with the film was the action, which you felt was nonsensical. This is also a common complaint for action movies, as viewers often expect the action scenes to be exciting and well-choreographed.

Despite the presence of good actors, it seems like the movie was still unable to deliver a satisfying experience. The overall lack of coherence and boredom in the film left you disappointed and wishing you had spent your time elsewhere.

In summary, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" was a tedious and poorly executed movie that failed to captivate its audience. Its unnecessarily long runtime and nonsensical action scenes only added to its overall lack of appeal.

Title: Great acting, weird story
Review:
This could have been really good. It has a cool concept and great acting but it was just too weird and borderline perverted at times. I'm not a prude but I have no interest in watching people with dildos and butt plugs fighting each other on screen. The hotdog hands were weird too. And it was also about 30 minutes too long. I was hitting pause to see how much time was left towards the end. Whoever wrote this has an odd sense of humor to say the least and that's being kind. Somehow this won all the awards though which should tell you something about the state of Hollywood now and probably also tells you something about why the Oscars are plummeting in ratings and interest. Maybe soon they'll make movies again that are inspiring and heroic instead of weird and perverse. Fingers crossed (not hotdog fingers)...
9 out of 15 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Oh dear, what a disappointment.
Review:
After seeing the number of Oscars this film won I was expecting something extraordinary. Sadly what we get here is just extraordinarily unsatisfying, overrated rubbish. Best actor? Seriously? Best film? Give me a break.

I almost never bother writing reviews, but when a film like this gets such a high approval rating I will always give it a try, and I feel compelled to submit this if only to add some balance to the people who seem to think massive amounts of (mostly digital) special effects, violence, quasi-scientific gobbledygook, tokenism and comic book fantasy make for an impressive film.

My advice? Give it a miss and watch Banshees of Inisherin if you want to see proper acting.
20 out of 29 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.
Permalink

Title: Tries too hard
Review:
So, the worst acting actors in this movie won an Oscar for Best Actor and Actress? The plot was the dumbest way to explain alternate universes. The movie thinks too highly of itself. They forced emotionality in scenes that make no sense. It's like going to a furniture store to buy a sofa, and just as you walk in, the cashier tells you, "That'll be $400 for the sofa." It just doesn't follow its own logic at all. The fact that it was even nominated, let alone winning ANYTHING, is mind-numbing, to say the least. Make no mistake, there is a big problem happening here. I don't know what it is, but something made this movie win the Oscar, and talent is not one of them.

Title: Decent but definitely overrated
Review:
They get points for creativity and acting, but people these days just go bonkers for anything with multiverses and cool effects. Don't think it lived up to the hype.

Title: I rarely walkout of films but could not take any more!
Review:
I think I've only ever walked out of three films in my life but after 2 hours of excruciating cinema I couldn't take anymore. My partner said after I suggested we leave .. 'Thank god for that!. I've been wishing we could leave an hour ago".

The storyline was too daft for words. Not funny at all and just so repetitive scene after scene. Flipping from one alternative universe to another.

Despite the underlying complexity of the daft 'multi-universe' storyline is was entirely predictable where it was heading. Ie. Mother not understanding her daughter. Fix that and all will be right with every universe!. Please, pass the vomit bucket.

How in the hell did this win best picture!

Title: Hurting nonsense
Review:
If you've got a brain, don't watch it. This will be a torture.

After reading the high rated reviews I see that those are from people who relate themselves to the characters and their family drama.

Title: Buckles under the weight of its own creativity
Review:
Everything Everywhere All at Once left me feeling simultaneously overwhelmed and underwhelmed. There's a lot to admire about this film. Its premise is original, the direction is very well done as is the editing, and the entire cast is genuinely great. When this film started, I thought I was going to love it, but as the movie went on I started to like it less and less. This movie feels like an art house film made for the Tik Tok generation. It's very random, overly chaotic, and absurdly fast-paced.

I can't help but feel that Everything Everywhere All at Once really buckles under the weight of its own creativity. It's a film that's trying to be a lot of different things. It wants to be an art film, a sci-fi film, a kung fu film, a comedy/absurdist film, and a family drama. I admire the ambition but it really began to feel like way too much after a while. The pacing is so breakneck that I literally began to get a headache, and it was hard for me to get emotionally attached to anything in the story because the movie was just throwing so much stuff at me constantly. It felt like the directors were trying way too hard just to show off.

I understood what this movie was trying to convey thematically. It's clearly a commentary on finding optimism in a nihilistic world, or in this case, worlds. I get it. But whatever genuine emotions this movie was trying to have, it all gets immediately undermined by nonstop visual gags, some of which were needlessly juvenile and all of which felt weird just for the sake of being weird. I think a great film to watch as a juxtaposition to this one is Eternal Sunshine of The Spotless Mind. That's a great example of a weird and highly original movie that doesn't have its depth or emotional weight undermined due to its staggering creativity.

I wanted to love this movie, really I did. And I understand why so many people do love it. It is different, there's no denying that, and who knows, perhaps during a rewatch I might feel differently but as of right now, Everything Everywhere All at Once feels like an overhyped film that is far too chaotic for its own good.

Title: How did this get an 8.4?
Review:
It's like they chopped a movie up like a pizza, picked one slice and played it over and over again for an hour longer than it needed to. Literally picked it for it's high rating and left shaking my head. After, my 12 year-old daughter turned to me and said: I didn't understand any of that.

Title: This movie is SO bad
Review:
I don't even know where to start, or how to describe this movie. Multi-verse? A cross between The Matrix, Inception and Buckaroo Bonzai, though not NEARLY as good as any of those. Incredibly, irredeemably silly at times. Extremely difficult to follow at others.

Probably 6-8 couples at the theater viewing I attended. Two couples walked out. My wife left halfway through. I've never walked out of a movie, but this is as close as I've ever been. It is about two hours long, but I could have sworn I was in there for 3 1/2 hours. The people that made it through the entire flick were simply shaking their heads when it was over.

I am stunned at the composite rating for this movie, both here and on Rotten Tomatoes. It makes me question the reliability of both.

Title: I don't take an Oscar seriously anymore
Review:
Does Hollywood mock the general public?

Were no good movies made that year at all?

Can marketing push any kind of useless scenario down our throats?

Well, at least the reviews don't seem to rigged if I see all the people that took the time to explain what a dissappointment this movie was.

An unoriginal, therefor not bad, idea that was worked out to long in endless plottwists and long scenes.

It seems like they let a couple of teenagers without any critical advice write this movie.

A pity for the cast, because some actors did an excellent job.

But good acting can clearly not right a wrong scenario..

Title: The most stupid movie I've ever watched
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: An incoherent mess of a film
Review:
This is my first review for IMDB. I've never felt the urge to write one before, but for this movie, I needed to. This is one of the worst movies I've seen in my life, and believe me, I've seen hundreds of bad movies before. The film centres around a woman who must connect with parallel universe versions of herself to prevent a powerful being from destroying the multiverse. That's basically the whole premise. The bulk of the film focuses on visiting multiverses that are just plain bizarre, including a world where everyone has hot-dog hands. There are many absurd moments in the film that are cringe-inducing and not funny to watch, like two men trying to insert objects into their butts and a man getting spanked in some weird BDSM-style world. The movie keeps switching between multiverses and becomes extremely hard to follow. The editing is just awful. The message of the movie basically boils down to the importance of family and accepting others. That would be fine if they didn't shoe horn all the multiverse baloney into the movie. The way the message of family is delivered falls flat. By the end of the movie, I ended up not caring for the characters. WIthout spoiling the movie, the "sense of threat" in the movie ends up having no impact on the movie. The movie takes ideas from films like The Matrix, but the sense of progression for the "hero's journey" is badly written. Characters suddenly do things in the film with no prior development. The pacing is just bad. None of the multiverse moments are interesting or funny to watch. The action scenes are badly choreographed too. Michelle Yeoh is an actress whose work I have loved in the past. In films like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, Supercop, and Tomorrow Never DIes, she proves that she can perform in great action scenes. Unfortunately, this movie wastes that potential. Yeoh's performance in the film is fine, but it is not Oscar-worthy material, especially compared to the great Cate Blanchett in Tar. The same thing applies to Ke Huy Quan. Although he was my favourite part of the movie, his performance is nowhere as great as Brandon Gleeson or Barry Keoghan in The Banshees of Inisherin. Stephanie Hsu's character is painfully annoying in the film. She comes off as arrogant and rude, even though she plays a crucial role in the story and the movie wants us to sympathize with her. Jamie Lee Curtis, an actress I've loved in the classic Halloween and True Lies, is almost non-existent in the film. Her character only appears for a handful of moments, none of which are especially memorable. I do not understand what is so great about her or Hsu's performance that warrants a Best Supporting Actress nomination.

Overall, this is not just an overrated movie, but an awful one too. By far the worst movie to ever be nominated for an Oscar. In a year with great films like Tar, The Banshees of Inisherin, All Quiet on The Western Front, and even Avatar: The Way of Water, it's shocking to see that this film is the Oscar frontrunner. The fact that it is nominated with as many Oscars as The Return of the King and Titanic is laughable. To those putting this in their top 5 of all time, you really need to watch more films.

Title: 5/10. One of the most overrated movies of all time
Review:
It's not difficult to understand why this movie is overrated as hell. Of course every movie critic would praise it and everyone knows the reason why.

I don't mind this movie's theme. Acceptance is this movie's theme and every person needs to feel it, every person needs to be accepted from his/her parents and friends and the society, in general. Especially when this person didn't do anything wrong. However, to be honest, it is not my favorite theme. If i knew what this movie is about, i wouldn't have watched it. I didn't connect with the characters here. I didn't care about their issues.

Philosophically speaking, I don't crave for acceptance. Only ourselves can grant us this thing. If we are ok with ourselves, we don't care about everyone's opinion. The need for acceptance is lowkey dangerous.

It's not only the theme. I mean, i liked a lot movies like MILK (2008), FLAWLESS (1999) etc. If this movie was well directed and had a good story, i would have appreciated it. Not the case here. This is a total mess. Chaotic, tiring, unstructured. And excessively long. It had five or six endings, my mind got numb. At the ending, i had stopped caring about everyone. These were somewhat likeable characters but during the last 20 minutes, i didn't care about what happened to them. Dead, alive, happy, sad, just please end it, i don't care.

I didn't like also the idea that "people are worthless pieces of ..". This movie tells us that there is not a meaning, that people mean nothing, that our actions have no consequences because, multiverse. This movie is way more nihilistic and devious than it seems. I am sorry that some people feel this way. But some of us still believe in something. Some of us believe in God. Some of us believe in an ideology. Some of us are reading books, philosophy, poetry, literatture.

There is something wrong about this movie.

Title: I can't... I mean... I don't even...
Review:
"Everything Everywhere All at Once", rated 8.6 (that's higher than Infinity War and Endgame) on IMDB.

Yet for me this was one of the most boring and lamest movies I've watched of all time. Certainly the silliest movie I've watched this decade. Impossible to take seriously and I imagine the high rating is due to all the emotional nonsense that's mostly near the end of the movie.

It was putting me to sleep halfway through and I felt exhausted after I finished it. I would take Morbius and Batman over this.

1/10, waste of time, will not elaborate further. Screw this movie.

Title: Dreadful Acid Trip Plot Offsets the Great Acting
Review:
The first time I attempted to watch the movie, I spent 45 minutes on it and gave up. A month later after all of the buzz and Oscar nominations I forced myself to stick with it to the end just to see if I was missing something. I wasn't, although Michelle Yeoh's acting is so good that there is a nice resolution for her at the end.

I admire creativity as much as the next movie fan, but this one is so over the top it looks as if the writers/directors were on an acid trip trying to insert a bunch of dream sequences. I suspect there is going to be a big backlash if it wins Best Picture. Yes, Michelle Yeoh deserves Best Actress, but the picture is not worthy.

Title: Mess Up
Review:
It's very long, and it's not an exaggeration to describe it as sitting on pins and needles. All the characters except Michelle Yeoh have no acting skills. The plot is messy. The American chicken soup is late but it arrives. When you enter the scene with your brain, no one will give you any room to think. Lie down. Just be indoctrinated. Is this the future of cinema?

Title: Dull
Review:
There is definitely an element of popularity in the film, through viewers keen to not come across as not understanding it and as with multiple examples before this, with unique arty films, publicly praising it makes you feel a better and more intelligent within yourself.

This was another such example. In one way, it is impossible to follow, you need 5-6 viewings before you would even start to pick up everything that is going on. But then on the contrary, becausw of that and the overall premise being fairly straightforward it also makes it quite easy to broadly follow, in that you are not required to 'get' every aspect of it.

The bigger problems with it, were parts of it were just ridiculous. Sausages for dings, fighting with dildos. It just seemed like a first draft of a film before a few more revisions.

The producers also needed to excerise the "less is more" philosophy. It just dragged on and on, like a concert, with the singer coming back on stage. It could have ended threw times in the 30 minutes before it did, without losing anything.

By the way, it's funny that the Jackie Chan movies from the 70s/80s of the twentieth century presented better fight choreography, and here, despite the latest special effects, it looks as if the actors were afraid that they would not get a button. Moving it to the Oscars competition and showering with 7 statuettes is a mockery of people working for decades for recognition in the film world.

Title: Overhyped
Review:
Its just a family drama and not even very deep one, and not a very good one. Family drama is on the level of average tv series... Concept of multiverse portrayed very nice and gives you the glimpse of how it feels. But thats it, movie awfuly lacks in deepness.

Production is on level but costume design is awful. Goofy devices that let you jump through universes are looking ok-ish, but the headquarters of Joy with beagle and people in there looks awful. There is no creativeness in their costumes its ruining the vibe so hard, its unbearable.

Overall its a trippy family drama with cosmic twist about multiverse. Do not expect much from this movie.

Title: Terrible
Review:
The worst multi Oscar winning movie of all time. Fell asleep watching it the first time, gave it another shot and only made it to 49 mins. This movie is what happens when there are outcries about inequality in Hollywood. This movie didn't deserve one award. It's painful to watch, and not artistic at all. The plot is all over the place, there are no scenes of comedy, everything is just done in such a way that it make the audience throw-up in their mouths just a little each scene. Curtis keeps making the same screams over and over that it makes one thing her brother is still out to get her. This was one of the worst movies made, the Academy Awards need to look in the mirror after this one, and think are they awarding talent and the best or just going along with certain groups who have questioned them.

Title: Really??
Review:
Tried to watch this 3 times

Attempt 1 - Gave up after 30 mins

Attempt 2 - Fell asleep after 50 mins

Attempt 3 - Seen it won 7 Oscars last night and decided to give it another go as it must have "something"?? Watched the full 2hours 20 mins with no distractions at all and I felt NOTHING as the credits rolled. An incredible concept that just missed on 90% of the areas that should of made it amazing! Far too jumpy, story was weak and humour was WAAAAY off (maybe just me).

Just goes to show how much of a slide the film industry is in at the moment if this cleans up all the awards!! After watching so much good TV over the last 10/15 years it pains me say this is the year Hollywood has finally died!

It actually just made my head hurt, a lot!!

Title: Don't bite into this bagel!
Review:
Feels like an overly long music video, really hate the fast cuts during the fight sequences & I just don't care about what's happening on screen. Does not work on an emotional level whatsoever, classic case of "style" over substance.

Underutilizes Michelle Yeoh

Jamie Lee is goofy as hell

Force feeds you it's themes in a way that's both abrasive & flagrant while masquerading as a deep layered art house flick.

Feels like a weird stew of what the directors thought either "fans" would like or whatever appeals to your average Netflix/Tik Tok user.

This cinematic experience is Nothing Nowhere Never.

Title: Go. Watch. Paint. Dry.
Review:
Nothing nowhere anytime - Overhyped garbage.

Did the Academy actually watch it? Or did they just give out awards to the movie with the most confusing plot and least amount of coherence?

I don't even know what this movie was supposed to be about. Generational minority immigration happenings? Parallel universes? Time travel? Family drama? It's like they threw everything and the kitchen sink into this movie and hoped for the best. Newsflash: it didn't work.

The only thing that kept me watching was the hope that it would all come together in the end. Spoiler alert: it didn't. Instead, I was left feeling frustrated and confused. Oh wait - i'm sure that was the goal? Or wasn't it? Maybe?

You value your sanity and your time? Steer clear of this disaster. It's not worth the aggravation or the high blood pressure. If you're still looking for a way to kill time, watch paint dry instead. It'll be a more entertaining use of your time.

The only reason I gave this movie one star is because I can't give it zero.

Title: Pretentious and empty.
Review:
For the amount of content contained within this film one would think the film would have some profound message but it doesn't.

The film presented here is nothing more than a superficial bloated mess. It left me thinking that this is a perfect example that maybe the directors should have followed the "less is more" adage.

There are some moments within the movie that the actor's talents are allowed to shine but unfortunately they are never really provided with material that has any weight to it or material that means anything. I just found my self feeling indifferent to any of the characters problems or successes.

I don't really know who this film was made for, all I know is that I am clearly not the intended audience.

Title: Strangest film I've ever seen
Review:
A friend and I saw this movie today. It's the 1st time I've rated a movie one star. The draw for me was 98-year-old James Hong, an actor whose career I've followed for over 50 years. We agreed that the script must have been written by someone on a bad acid trip. We were ecstatic when it was finally over, because we didn't understand it at all. I still enjoy watching James Hong, but whatever the message of this film is, we definitely missed it.

Title: Son of a Fish Called Wanda
Review:
Last night, we were watching "Everything Everywhere All at Once." I had really, really, really been looking forward to this movie. But after an hour of crude jokes and endless "kung-fu" fighting, we had to stop.

The movie opens in a home/laundromat and soon moves to an IRS office. There, Evelyn slaps an auditor who promptly calls building security. Evelyn's husband severely disables the entire team. These days, my sympathies are with building security.

In order for a person to trigger a jump between "universes," they need to perform a weird and unpredictable act, like shoving an small office trophy up their butt or saying, "I love you," and meaning it. I love you? With still another hour to go, we never really got out of the IRS office. That was enough.

Maybe it was the presence of an unrecognizable Jamie Lee Curtis, but this movie reminded me of another comedy also celebrated for the cruelty of its humor: A Fish Called Wanda (1988). That movie sports an also inexplicable 7.5 IMDB rating. You could call this a "Son of a Fish."

Title: I watched this heap thinking its domination of the Oscars implied it would be worth the time and money.
Review:
Over the same weekend of the Oscars, two banks failed. People think the bank failures could indicate more days ahead filled with comparable bad news and indications of corruption or poor managerial judgement. That symbolism is far easier to understand relative to this movie that any of its scenes. The Oscar awards this movie recieved tell me that Hollywood is in dire straights.

This movie is excruciating but I stuck it out thinking something was going to give it redemption. It never comes.

In trying to understand this lengthy mess, I am reminded that there are people who believe other countries are attempting to test the depths of Americans ability to be fooled in mass.

Title: Love it or hate it
Review:
This is one of those films that you either love or hate, and ratings prove it. You will be either enchanted by it or have your intelligence insulted. I could not sit through 45 minutes of it. Wife fell asleep after 25. Call me ignorant and out of touch but I tried to like it, scouts honor, but simply could not connect to it. It is profusely arrogant in its narrative, disjointed and superficial. I did not understand the point of overzealous fight scenes and while it tries to "blow your mind" it simply comes across as smart as a fortune cookie. It invested so little in character development that I could not give a crap for any of them. It is completely beyond me that this drivel could have won so many Oscars that it did.
14 out of 23 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.

Title: A Crime Against Insanity
Review:
This film is so bad it's funny. The sets and story, meaning behind the film, dialogue, action, acting, scenes are so terrible that I rate it 1 because I couldn't stop howling with laughter. Hollywood's finally done it, they've given all the Oscars to one of the worst films ever made. It's a shame with all these well made films this year, like Banshees of Inishirin, Tar, Babylon, Blonde, The Batman, All Quite On The Western Front, The Wonder. As Groucho Marx would say ''It's A Crime Against Insanity''. Believe me if the Marx Brothers were around today they would have so much material. I think Hollywood needs to sign the insanity clause. Maybe Santa Clause does actually exist.

Title: Awful
Review:
Why the hype? Why the good reviews?

It was only because of so much positivity around it that I lasted 30 mins before eventually realising that I just don't get it and then I went away to do literally anything else instead.

For me personally, the 30 minutes I endured were noisy and meaningless and full of cliches from any number of Tarantino bubblegum movies, noting in my opinion that his movies are way better.

Maybe the movie improves after the first half an hour, maybe the story line starts to gain some clarity, but for me I was ready to quit after the first 10 minutes, staying with it for a bit longer to try to understand why people are loving it.

Oh well, my partner loved it, so whilst she enjoyed the rest of the film I want away to wash up the dinner dishes and then deep clean the kitchen.

Title: weirdest movie of all time
Review:
I like the actors in the movie (especially santa), but it was too hard to follow and just too strange for me. To each his own. Would not recommend to anyone.

Title: So stupid!
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: Unfortunate delivery
Review:
Even though this movie is able to present very good acting through an outstanding production, it chose a very unfortunate way to deliver a message. A blend of all sorts of movie genres that did not end up smooth.

Unnecessarily long and at times confusing, it keeps trying too hard to push the envelope and ends up losing the audience. It did lose me, at least, totally unamused and confused with all the hype.

Title: Primitive Existential Crisis
Review:
Without spoiling you, basically this is just another nihilistic movie about existential crisis that states the solution for finding a reason to don't suicide is loving your family and your partner therefore this movie disappointed me. If I had known this movie has a such point of view I wouldn't watch it. I only gave 5 out of 10 just because of its sense of humour, otherwise the movie is very empty uninteresting movie. I liked cinematography, the style of the movie and the acting in general but these had no effect on my score.

So, what if you cannot love anybody but yourself and you don't care about having a partner? That's why this movie is primitive because it assumes everyone cares about their biological programming. It's better to only love yourself and enjoy your life by enjoying yourself by being yourself no matter what. But according to this movie everyone would suicide when they don't have family and they don't have a partner which doesn't make sense.

In detail, it just didn't make sense when people start to have existential crisis just because they could travel between parallel universes. And it didn't make sense why they started to believe "nothing matters". It doesn't make sense because if you are such a person you would believe "nothing matters" when you living your only one life so how being aware of living in lots of parallel universes can make you believe "nothing matters"? In real life people don't suicide because somehow they enjoy their life and they have no reason to suicide. It's not about what matters. It's all about they believe living life is better than suiciding even though they may believe "nothing matters".

I also think the idea of "nothing matters" depends on the context. For example when you have a husband and a child who loves and needs you, your life and therefore everything matters because you have to be part of the family so you have to judge everything in the context of if it will hurt your family or not. That's how family works. But for example for me it wouldn't matter to do something to save the human race because the human race doesn't matter to me. They will die anyway so what's the point? In that regard I think "nothing about the human race matters" as well as "nothing about my life matters" but I didn't have to be aware of my lives in parallel universes and I'm not suicidal. Carpe diem, bruh. No reason to be emo about it. But I think Nacho Cheese Doritos matters because it taste so good.

I think it was the right choice to make this movie have a decent sense of humor otherwise I would stop watching this movie after like 30 minutes because it was very boring but I stayed for the sense of humour. The Crazy random interesting sense of humour saved my day.

Title: Really weird movie
Review:
I am normally very good with these types of movies but this one one fell off and had no idea what was going on.

First 40 or 50 minutes was good but this then went somewhere that I cannot even explain, not in a good way.

I love MY, she is excellent and the kid from the Goonies (could not mistake his voice) was wonderful in his role but this was an experiment gone wrong in term of story.

Not sure why this is rated so highly, maybe like the joker, everyone was giving it 10's when it was like a 6 or 7....
