Title: Frenetic activity and Subtitled so you can't watch the action
Review:
While I know a lot of people really liked this movie, it's one major flaw is that for those who don't understand Mandarin and Cantonese have to read the subtitles. Since the action is all over the place, having to look at subtitles to be able to understand what is being said keeps you from being able to watch the movie to see what is happening. It's a terrible combination.

I found that after watching for about 45 minutes, I was exhausted and completely disinterested in watching any more of it.

They took a high-level topic of a multiverse and made a stupid movie about it. The activities were stupid. Their meeting with the IRS agent was stupid. Virtually everything in the movie was stupid. Not funny, not interesting, just frenetic, stupid, random activities.

I'd give it negative stars if that were a rating.

I'm glad we saw it for free, so I didn't waste anything but 45 minutes of my time on it.

Title: The intersection of dad jokes and things a teenager thinks up while high
Review:
Is this a bad movie? No. Is it a good movie? Not really.

At its roots, the story is fairly simple: a woman finds out that she's the only one who can stop an evil(-ish) force. And she learns how to be a better person along the way. There aren't really any surprises as far as the story goes; it's a series of cliches that don't add up to much.

The action is basic. Nothing special, nothing particularly interesting. The humor is uncreative and lame: there's a Ratatouille spoof called Racacoonie (it's a raccoon); in an alternate universe, people have hot dog fingers; there's a bagel with literally everything on it... it feels like there's not a single idea that wouldn't fit on a Venn diagram crossover between dad jokes and things a teenager would think up while high.

The ending is the worst part. We know what's going to happen. We've seen it a thousand times before. But it just drags on and on and on. It could've easily shaved ten minutes off in the last half hour. Hell, maybe the whole last half hour could've been skipped.

I'd most recommend this for the "film bro" type and people who are shallow but think they're deep.

Title: Over hyped
Review:
Paid to watch on Amazon with family expecting a real treat. Not sure why there are so many rave reviews, the film was like a bad trip, or as someone succinctly put it like surfing several channels until you get a chaotic storyline which makes no sense.

When it got to the bit where people had hotdog fingers we gave up.

Is like a bunch of teenagers on amphetamines brainstormed ideas for a movie, with one suggesting Kung fu, another suggesting South Korean family with predictable issues, another suggesting multi verse theory, and some suggesting a nod towards something profound which film goers will feel obligated to mention although they have been sold a dud.

A bit like the story of the Emporer who wore no clothes.

Everybody hyping it up because so many others are doing it and they don't want to look as if they have missed a trick.

So bad.

Title: Overrated
Review:
Not sure how this got such a high rating. It's weird as hell and it made no sense whatsoever. The visual effects were somewhat ok that's why it gets a 2 but man, I think you need to be high off your mind to appreciate something like this. Really can't understand how people can enjoy this, I stopped after 1 hour watching. I can that it has Asian characters and that it shows real life situations: taxes, stress, business etc but I don't think it deserved such the praise it did as I saw nothing special about this movie. I'm not a cinema connaisseur by any means so maybe I'm missing the art in this movie but I was hella not into it.

Title: Messy
Review:
My husband and I tried to like this, but it was all over the place. Hotdog fingers, dildos, googly eyes? We can't understand all the great reviews and nominations. We love movies of all genres , but truly didn't like this one. The acting was good if there is something nice to say. Jamie Lee Curtis up for an Oscar for her role? Weren't there other roles more worthy? We didn't understand that either.

We kept watching as the beginning held our interest, but it just got too silly and crazy. It was just a big ridiculous mess. How so many others can claim this movie is a masterpiece is a complete mystery to us.

Title: What a load of old nonsense
Review:
It seemed like a good premise at the start and the performances were good, but it quickly became too ridiculous. The attempts at humour were lame and not at all funny - like elementary school playground humour.

I find it hard to believe all the 10 and 9 star reviews are real reviewers and not Mechanical Turk. No 6s, 7s, or 8s? Just 9s and 10s! I'm adding this review in an attempt to redress the balance.

I went into this movie with high expectations but was severely let down. There's a false "The End" part way through the film and I thought, "Thank god this drivel is over", but then there was more.

It could maybe have been a good movie if they just dropped the juvenile comedy that didn't work and either replaced it with more grown-up humour or just left it out.

Title: Wtf
Review:
Is this the favorite for the academy award this year, really??!!! What's special about this movie?!!! There's no plot! The movie is boring, confusing and slow...there's no bottom line! There's nothing but a few action and fighting sequences. It's impossible to tell the movies story because there's really not one. It's just a bunch of people from an Asian family in US that own a laundry and l from there the movie turns in and I'm incomprehensible story and nonsense fiction and confusing dialogues that lead nowhere at all! It's hard to believe that this filme can get that attention it has been getting. It's boring and in a year or two no one will watch it.

Title: Not that good
Review:
I've had really high expectations before watching the movie because the cast and the plot seemed really interesting.

Well, the first 15 minutes were interesting and promising. And then I suddenly it turned into a storyline which I couldn't follow anymore. I really wanted to be sucked into the whole plot, but it didn't work out. I had a feeling that too much attention was put into the costumes and action moves which resulted in the lack of any depth. I couldn't connect to the characters. It felt like they were having the same dialogue over and over again, although the scenes were changing rapidly. All in all, I was bored and couldn't wait for the movie to end.

Title: Lobster anyone ?
Review:
I can't help but mention The Lobster since I don't remember disliking a film as much since The Lobster . And I sat through this one thinking the same thing.. are we there yet? Will it ever end ? What's it about anyway? Did someone slip her a drug I didn't notice ? Was it caused by one of those games you put on your head and on her it triggered an unending distortion of reality? How about a nervous breakdown ? But then I'm told to not take it too seriously ??!! In college I never understood the books we had to read on symbolism. Is this a dose of that?? I give credit to the actors but that's where it ends . I hated it just like The Lobster .

Title: Nauseating
Review:
What in this Universe made this bloody and violent creation earn 11 Oscar nominations is beyond me.

Maybe the creative variety of violent tricks and methods of destroying and maiming human bodies appealed to many viewers, and yet I found non-stop creative bloody violence on the screen exhausting.

It is surprising how unconvincing and simple the idea behind the many minutes of loud senseless fighting turns out to be.

I haven't remembered leaving the movie theatre feeling disgusted and nauseous ever until today.

I gave the movie two stars though I feel the actors deserve much better ratings than the movie itself.

Title: Everything going downhill and you throw up, smiling.
Review:
This is the best proof that fast pace and great look are for music clips. One should not call it a "movie". Specially when characterized as " fantasy, comedy, action and sci-fi", all at the same time. Nonsense , made for the TikTok generation. Comes from nothing, leads to nowhere. Shows how a high note on IMDB does not necessarily leads you to a great experience. Thankfully there are a lot of good movies been made nowadays. This is not one of them.

Title: Wacky, too wacky
Review:
The main point of the story, that is, the hypothetical existence of multiple universes with all the lives you could have lived and being able to jump from one to the other, might be the basis for a good story. However, they decided to make a 100% wacky movie, with loads of visual effects, totally implausible endless kung-fu fighting, and very very little story. The sub-plots get also lost here: the gay daughter coming out of the closet to her conservative grandpa, the immigrant Chinese family, who had to adapt to the US and is struggling with the IRS. There's stuff here to tell a real story, and no need to flashy visual effects.

Add to this dubious production choices. Both main characters are portrayed by actors who are Cantonese speakers, but in the movie they are depicted talking in Mandarin to each other and in Cantonese to the grandpa. This won't impact English speaking viewers, but it only makes sense to add more confusion to the Chinese audience.

Title: Waste of time
Review:
I actually signed up to IMDB, just to give my 2cts on this useless film. The actors look surprised the full length of the film, they don't have a clue what's going on, because there is frankly not a lot going on. The plot is just all over the place, trying to blend the Matrix with a bunch of other films, but fails miserably on virtually every cinematic quality one could think of.

There is no interesting storyline to speak of, no real sense of accomplishments, no goals in sight and none are achieved in the end. It's taking the most boring realities of plain life, and tries to spice it up with alternative universe mumbo jumbo. It is a mess, I promise you, and the film is not even trying to streamline it. It's like a bumbed down version of The Matrix, with pills lying everywhere, taken all at once, resulting in one giant mess.

I can't believe this film has gotten so many oscars. Perhaps it's a result of lacking competition?

Title: Do I live in a alternate Mulitiverse?
Review:
Went in with high expectations but unfortunately this movie dissapointed me big time. The best part was the beginning but as soon as the action started and the so called plot thickened I ended up being rather dissapointed. I was really expecting the best movie of 2022 so far. The trailer was promising and after Rotten tomatoes held a poll on their Instagram page about A24's best movie ever , this one came out as a winner beating The Lighthouse and Uncut Gems, movies which I enjoyed.

Too much action scenes. And what's up with the bagel? And what about all the crazy costumes? After I read the positive reviews again I slowly realized; Do I live in a Multiverse?

Title: Too bizarre...
Review:
I was excited to see this because of all the Oscars it won. But I was very disappointed...

The concept of the movie is really cool and it had potential to be so good! There are just too many weird scenes, and for me it was a bit too much. It distracted from the main story. Parts of the movie are just so strange!!! I feel like if it was a little more serious and the alternate universes were more realistic it would have been really good.

I will say the acting was great and the visual effects were pretty good too. I also enjoyed the overall themes of the movie. I just had to look past all the super weird parts to actually enjoy the movie.

Overall, as creative as the movie is, it did not live up to the hype.

Title: Exaggerated "comedy" scenes that make you rather roll your eyes
Review:
I cannot agree with the overall rating. The beginning was promising and it was a good intro, but the plot got really messy and you could barely follow what is happening. The movie was overly filled with exaggerated scenes of cheap humor that rather triggered a reaction of "Oh, come on". Possibly more entertaining for youth rather than people in late twenties or older.

The idea itself is good, but it wasn't very well put into the movie. If I wasn't watching this movie in the cinema, I would stop watching it in the middle of it, but I am, in the end glad that I saw till end because of the last scenes, which were actually alright and earned one more star for the rating.

Title: A philosophy course that painfully drags.
Review:
Sorry, I couldn't get into it. It's like picking thru the mind of an elderly Asian woman and learning why she hates her life, why she can't figure out her lesbian daughter, then blames her dad for it all. That's it in a nutshell. If you got the time to sit down and go thru their philosophy, this is your thing. I've heard people mention "nihilism". Nah...it's "absurdism" all the way. People walked out, not to come back, just to walk out.... I cheered them on. It was an experience..that, ultimately, wasn't my thing. I'm not glad I saw this.
2 out of 9 found this helpful. Was this review helpful? Sign in to vote.

Title: Disappointing -- good message buried in MOUNDS of rubble.
Review: Serious disappointment. Considering the cast drawn together for this film, It had such potential, especially considering the concept behind the story. It takes a grand concept and falls victim to the challenge of trying to do everything everywhere all at once. If you're familiar with the movie "Up", just imagine "squirrel" distractions 96% throughout the film. There is an element in the movie the characters seek to avoid (unless you've been drawn in and then they are driven towards it: a bagel - yes a bagel. Mushrooms would have served better because consuming bagels before making a movie never ended so badly. The story -- the core of it -- could have been relayed in about 12 minutes. The rest was belabored. The acting was notable, especially by Quan. Hsu and Yeoh have the standout moments as well where they either are on mark or draw you in to the story, but this movie is ridden with so much that weighs it down -- who knew fluff could be so heavy?? Do yourself a favor and go buy a bagel instead - don't get sucked in. Either that or eat some mushrooms (not recommended) and make your own movie... it can't be any worse.

save your time and money find something else to watch this is a complete garbage can

Title: most annoying movie I have ever watched
Review:
It was so incredibly bad. The linse were terribly clich√©, the 'humor' was for 12-year old permanently online "random = funny XDDDD" kids, the 'philosophy' was the most drab and overused optimistic nihilism, the ending was one big eye-roll fest ("family and love saves the dayyyy"), the characters were incredibly ugly and uncharismatic, the sci-fi gimmick makes no sense and is inconsistent in its own universe, it is intentionally filled with cringe, the plot is just all filler and the end is very drawn out, the action makes no impact because everything is possible so the audience cannot care (if they think for just a few seconds), etc...

Title: A celebration of nihilism
Review:
I thought I'd love this movie but ended up leaving overwhelmed and at odds with the nihilistic message. It is unique, and it looks like it has a much higher budget than it had, but ultimately it felt like a tornado symbolizing the supposed joy behind embracing a collective loss of meaning. There were a huge amount of cuts in the film making it seem like a music video more than a movie in some places. The action was well choreographed and there were some genuinely funny moments, but it felt as though it was selling and celebrating a nihilistic philosophy that assumes that all of one's actions are of no importance. That said, I predict that this will resonate with many people, and will become a modern classic as it is quite original, as well as acting as apologetics for postmodern living. There was a lot to like about the film, but I couldn't like it overall due to its terrible messages.

Missed opportunity.

Title: Massive Pile Of Sh√Æte
Review:
I watched this Jay night because if the 8+ recite it got here on IMDB. If only I'd read down through the reviews and sage the more realistic ones.

I did enjoy watching the film recuse of the style but it all fell apart towards the end. It didn't make much sense and it came to a pretty stupid conclusion.

Title: How does a movie where someone kicks a dog win an oscar
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: I don't get it at all ...
Review:
I saw this film being nominated for an award, so I thought I would give it a whirl. Jamie Lee Curtis and Yeoh plus a recommended story line, I had high hopes. It was over 2 hours of my life I will not get back. It is confusing, difficult to follow and exhausting as the film jumps between subtitles and English. I guess that the story was well intentioned and there is obviously a huge following who enjoyed the film and its randomness. It certainly ranks high in the 'weirdness' scale. Somewhere in the multiverse there is a version of this which I will understand, but I fear that no matter how times that I watch this, its popularity baffles me.

Title: One of the dumbest movies, kept expecting it to get better
Review:
My husband and I watched this movie until the end but kept saying how did it get an Oscar nomination for best picture and 10 other nominations? It has been described as an "artistic" movie but it did not have much of a plot and the whole movie was meaningless. The special effects, costumes and music were not anything special and yet received a nomination in each of those categories. The only nomination that made slight sense was for best actress, Michelle Yeoh.

It must be a slow year for movies. We kept watching hoping it would get better since the movie received so many nominations. It did not.

Title: People pay your taxes
Review:
The moral of the story, you can fix your relations with your family members, on several plains of multiple universes, you can get away with plenty of murders and get forgiveness, you can defeat an undefeatable adversary, but you can't escape taxes. That's a strong message. Apart from that, only clich√©s stolen from another movies, Matrix, Scary movie 5, all the other multiverse movies. Too long on the morality scenes, too boring since we knew how's gonna end a mile away. A solid 5, but far from "The best movie of the year". Women power, of course, It could not be the other way. My 2 cents. 4 stars.

Title: Disappointing

Chaotic action , and I get distracted , The film cannot hold me in its plot. Jamie Lee Curtis is good in the role and entertaining, but without significant action.

I don't understand this movie I love science fiction, but it has to make sense.

One must be able to relate to something.

The 3 stars are to be able to keep hope for a good film.

And acting, which means that this film does not fall completely through.

A technically good film.

The entertainment value is low. I take nothing away from this movie but bewilderment and wasted time.

If you're looking for scifi that makes sense, look elsewhere.

The cast is excellent, the emotions genuine and the cinematography beautiful.

My problem is the fantasy garbage nonsense this movie had to be packaged with to resonate with the popcorn audience.

There is good weird and there is Tenet weird. This is the later and that is bad for my tastes..

Title: Bad time to quit drinking.
Review:
If you're a student of the metaphysical and enjoy movies that are cerebral and preach then this is the movie for you. The people that gave this a good review are probably trying to justify the time they invested and money spent going to the the theater. I did not expect this movie to be linear but there seemed to be so many different aspects that it was almost impossible to assimilate where it was heading. It's somewhat anticlimactic and takes forever to get there. There were many parts that could have been left on cutting room floor. I gave this a two because I love Michelle Yeoh (have seen all her movies) and she deserves best actress for doing an amazing job. The acting in general was good and somewhat helped to redeem watching.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: A lot of hype, but not great.
Review:
I kept hearing how great this movie was and that it was ground-breaking, best movie since the matrix. I realize people have different tastes, but this movie was not for me. It was so bad that after about 40 minutes I could not force myself to watch anymore. The reviews are also artificially inflated on amazon as well...Amazon doesn't let you review the movie unless you watch the whole thing, so guaranteed there are other people who would rate it low but their reviews are not allowed. For reference which movies do I like: Fight Club, The Matrix are probably my favorites. TV series: I loved DEVS and Breaking Bad.

Title: This rated higher than Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. WTF
Review:
I don't usually walk out of movies but I just stopped caring what was going on after about 15 minutes. I gave it a chance because i loved Michelle Yeoh in Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. What a confused mess of a movie. Just colourful flashy fight scenes , regular lols and the occasional pasted-in dialogue that apparently is meant to make me connect with one of the characters.

It actually makes me sad that this got 7 Oscars and rates higher on IMDB than Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon. To watch CTHD and then watch this just serves to highlight how good and how bad a movie can be.

Maybe if I had the attention span and emotional range of a peanut I might find it amusing or interesting.

Title: What a mess
Review:
I find this movie Highly overrated, I had big expectations due to the 8+ rate. But after having watched the movie for half an hour I got bored already. The first scenes are pretty good, the introduction, the family and the busy chaos is drawing you into the movie but when the multiverse thing starts it is getting bad, the movie itself becomes a chaos with tacky and cheap scenes which make no sense at all. This movie is from that moment onwards really a mess and especially the fragmented and bad storytelling makes that I lost interest. I find this movie worth no more than a 4. Also I regret to have spend al, that money for the tickets.

Title: Too much for me
Review:
It seems there would be a lot of ways to tell a story of a woman learning to appreciate her life and that kindness and understanding can have a positive impact on those around her. I really liked the actors and where this tale ended but my gosh what a long, repetitive, flashy two hours to get to that point. As others have said: I was done with the Marshall arts, universe travel, "comedy" after about 20 minutes. It went on so long that I barely made it to the end. I wondered how people would choose this movie over Banshees of Inisheren or The Fabelmans as the best film of the year. It was too much!

Title: All At Once!
Review:
I have never seen a movie like this. This is the best movie for multiverse lovers. Much better than Doctor Strange. A mix between Matrix, Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind, Inception, and Terrence and Phillip from South park. Science Fiction, Kung-Fu, A surprising amount of emotional depth,It's got Everything! But maybe just a tad of The Emperor's New Clothes to it. You like the characters. Seems like a close knit family struggling with the same day-in, day out issues that we all have to deal with. I'm just not comfortable with this "what if" multiverse story-line. The cast deserves awards as a whole.. The movie starts strong, but drags on. Then it proceeds to go into the absurd.

Title: It finally happened.....
Review:
I've finally met the movie that is so horrendously bad it propelled me to create an IMDB account.....

The movie took the concept of multiverse and did some interesting things, I'll give it that. The rest? Don't expect anything good anywhere else. Non-existent plot, poor character development, and overused slapstick humour.

From the beginning till the very end, I never understood what the villain wanted, why the main character decided to do what she did, nothing ties together. It's all just a hot mess

After Black Panther and this movie, the Oscars has lost all credibilities. The fact this movie won 7 Oscars makes me sincerely worry about the mental health of our society.

The emotions were completely absent.

Title: Bizarre Movie
Review:
This movie was none of the things I thought it would be. Completely beyond me how this is receiving high ratings.

It's all over the place related to the rules it establishes for it's universe. Without spoiling anything there is no way you could randomly evoke an instance of yourself with specific sets of skills. It would take a million tries but with this... no.

If you put even the slightest thought into this it falls apart.

The other thing is they often go quite low brow with the humor and its usually not very funny. I did laugh a few times at random but most of the bits missed me.

Title: Good ideas, poor execution
Review:
I had high hopes for this movie. I grew up watching Michelle Yeoh before she broke onto the Hollywood screen. The plot is interesting and creative, but the execution was poor. It was hard to make heads or tails between scenes once I got to the second half of the movie.

There are several entertaining scenes on each of their own, but overall as the movie progressed it got kind of ridiculous and melodramatic. I found myself sighing and rolling my eyes then checked my phone to see how much longer it had left.

Despite how much I like Michelle Yeoh and how glad I am to see an Asian-American movie making it big in Hollywood, I kind of hated this movie. Sorry not sorry.

Title: Terrible
Review:
Didn't understand it. Didn't like it. If felt like a huge 140-minute crazy nonsense videoclip. Or perhaps a collage of multiple disturbing TikToks. There's no need to accumulate reels to reach 140 minutes in a movie! I stopped watching it at the half, which I do very rarely. The other Best Picture movies of this year are way better than this one. They have pauses, they have a script and real life elements. I tried to get the modern acid trip this movie tried to propose but I just couldn't grasp it. If this is the goal, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas is better than this, just as a quick comparison. Bottom line: don't waste your time with this.

Title: Polarising
Review:
I suspect that if you 'get' this film, you'll love it. If you don't 'get' it, you'll find it quite painful to watch. I didn't get it.

Yes, it's an assault on the senses and those describing it as an acid trip are likely quite correct. But for me, those are not positive qualities.

Title: What is happening with these reviews?
Review:
I was really looking forward to this movie based on early reviews and I have never been so disappointed and confused by the end of a film. This movie starts off really promisingly,solid character work and an intriguing plot. Then everything goes off the rails at around the 1 hour mark. This seems to be the main praise from all the 9/10 star reviews, but I have to ask whether these people enjoyed what they were watching, or simply want to support creative cinema despite how watchable it is. Im all for expression and out of the box ideas, but the narrative completely falls apart by the last 30 minutes, recycling the same "epiphany" type scene over and over again until the point of complete boredom. Iv never wanted a film to end more whilst being in the cinema as I was so frustrated and burnt out by the end.

Title: Laundry Shop Matrix for Stoners
Review:
This film make a strong case for not packaging a series pilot as a film - there were too many arcs in this stoner sci-fi to be coherently held together in a film, even one as long as this. It is rich and effusive, unusual, hilarious and even challenging at times, but at heart, it is a forgetable Hollywood sci-fi film with great pretensions at low budget cinematic art. A brilliant failed series that makes for a rather ordinary, if bright and colourful blockbuster.

Title: Would've been great 10 years ago
Review:
This movie was definitely a trip like others mentioned, but one I would've walked out on if I wasn't with friends. The sheer amount of ridiculous and juvenile humor would've worked a lot better when that style of humor was popular in the early 2010s, but now it just seems too cheesy and annoying for my liking. The last act of the movie is definitely more enjoyable than the rest of it and the overall message was good, but I can't see why people thought this movie was one of the greatest of the decade. To each their own I suppose.

Title: The trailer was far better than the movie, but sums it up fine, confused? You will be!
Review:
A few funny moments, some Scifi inspired elements, and insane violent action scenes that distracts you from the deeper meaning, if any. You can always find some lessons from certain parts, but you have to do the whole work yourself.

If a movie has to be explained and be watched with a guide to be able to follow it and get it, then I don't care to watch it.

I like to watch a movie where we have to figure out things and they don't overexplain every detail, but here I got the impression that the more confusing the made it the better they felt it would be, like the whole goal was to only be artistic yet pointless.

I felt a huge let down from a over hyped movie, I expected some universal qualities and didn't find then, when the movie finished it was a strong anti climax, just wasted an evening with that nonsense.

Title: Stunning and disturbing
Review:
I felt drawn into this movie from the very strange beginning. From there it got stranger and stranger and disturbing. As soon as I saw the "awards" I knew there would be something bad on the screen and I wasn't wrong about that. If I had known that scene was in the movie there's no way I would have watched it. I don't think the alternative lifestyle theme took the movie anywhere either and was more of a distraction than anything else. The actors themselves were absolutely fantastic. I really enjoyed all of them. I'm giving the movie a 5 out of 10 because it was very well made but ultimately disturbing. Time for some mental bleach.

Title: ANYTHING ELSE, ANYWHERE...BUT NOT THIS MOVIE!
Review:
I have never been driven to write a review on IMDB until I watched this movie and I've been using IMDB for years. Basically, it's schmaltzy sugar-laden mother/daughter relationship drivel wrapped up in some over-the-top martial arts, mixed with some implausible sci-fi meanderings and topped off with some childish, peurile attemps at comedy. The result is a mish-mash of confused, messy, pseudo waffle that pretends to try answer some of life's biggest questions....or was it just the craziest most pointless load of twoddle ever committed to film.....honestly I couldn't wait for it to end....give it a miss and go and do something....anywhere.......but not watching this movie.

Title: Torn between a rating of 1 and 10. Literally
Review:
On the one hand it has the deep message that others have referred to coupled with complete originality and imaginative production. On the other hand it's 2+ hrs of my life I won't get back and for no real entertainment value.

Not sure that I want to spend any more time entering the minimum 600 characters on this review which kind of suggests that a rating of one is where I'm leaning on this. I don't leave many reviews but value the input of those that do. So adding my tenpeneth worth on this one. Hope it helps others make an informed view. Watch this for 30 mins to get a sense of the creativity that has gone into this and then switch over.

Title: Messy, disconnected concept that doesn't work
Review:
There are some good parts. Conceptually interesting and starts with promise but gets more disconnected and messy as the film progresses. Some acts are just pointless showing of of directorial skills, some to fit in fights scenes perhaps. Some I can't fathom their purpose. I get the central concept that life is messy and so the film tries to convey that in its structure but it's really over done.

It's a shame as somewhere in this mess there is a better film trying to get out. One that is probably 30 minutes shorter. Perhaps one day we'll see it although I'm not sure having lost over two hours of my life I'd be willing to risk it again.

Title: Tough for vision impaired
Review:
Looks like a great movie, but it's impossible to watch for vision impaired. They speak English 90% of the time, but just randomly slip back and forth with subtitles. Those of us that have impaired vision skip movies with subtitles. But the worst for us are movies that randomly go subtitles and foreign language off and on. Probably doesn't matter to most, but unwatchable for people with vision problems.

Title: What were the Critics Choice Awards thinking?
Review:
One of the absolute worst films I've ever seen. I couldn't get through half of it. I don't understand the high ratings it has received. Am I watching the same film? Not only is it NOT funny, but it's far-fetched, ridiculous and doesn't even have a good plot line. It put me in the worst mood bc I will not get that hour back.

The acting is way over the top. I'm surprised Jamie Lee Curtis agreed to this film, but then again, she did Halloween, so there you go. Save yourself two hours and do not bother with this film (if you even want to call it that), unless you enjoy the genre that "Attack of the Killer Tomatoes" falls in. What a waste!

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: Absurdly bizarre film
Review:
This is a non sense and absurd movie. Overrating is evidence that is a total error to trust what people think is entertainment that deserves to win awards. That reminds me why I preferred to see a list of awarded films instead of watching a boring event that last hours, watching how overrated movies like this are nominated.

Some critics refer to some deep thoughts mentioned in ten seconds of the movie, but that doesn't justifies wasting 140 minutes of your time; so disappointing. If your inner voice make you react and take you back to this line of the multiverse to take the remote control and skip some grotesque scenes, then there is still hope for you, if not, we'll most likely your mind is already trapped in an alternate reality.

Hope that you can cleanse your mind after throwing this content on it.

Title: terrible waste of time
Review:
Jesus christ this is a terrible movie. It is like Rick and Morty if Rick and Morty was unfunny and a movie. A lot of cringe parts and the only humor they could muster was lowest common denominator. I don't find it hilarious that they fought with giant dildos, or that they had to shove a giant butt plug up their ass to fight. I've gone to middle school so I've heard those jokes before.

It is also incredibly long and boring, and when it is finally over, no it's not, there's still two more gd parts. The majority of this movie was either terrible, sophomoric 'comedy' or fight scenes that were done horribly and are incredibly unrealistic.

I am so angry I wasted two hours on this I will never get back, and shocked that people enjoyed this. Maybe if you are really immature and not that smart you will like it, but if you like actually good movies you should find something else to watch.

Title: Not sure what other people see in this movie.
Review:
This movie does not know what it wants to be. Poor dialouge, universe jumping, forgettable characters. It has the makings of a low brain but high budget sci fi thriller. It was hard to watch all the way through and continually lost interest with so many fast cuts. I do love sci fi and even much slower paced films like Stalker of Blade runner 2049 but those had an intriguing story that really carried the plot along. It almost just seemed like the director was just trying to cram as many random things and plot elements in at once to wow the audience. Like this movie was made for a tik tok attention span. I just don't understand the appeal of this film.

Title: Mediocre Attempt at Philosophical Cinema with Many Flaws.
Review:
This movie was too long it got me weary and movies are not supposed to do that. This movie is not for general audiences that was clear. It is for a segmented group and even then, many may not see it for what it was; a cultural fusion of Asian / gay with a twist of alien philosophies that are based on a chaotic take on multiple universes. Think of this as two camps; one born out of Atheism and the other from religion. Religion views it as one universe that is orderly while the other chaotic. But this movie falls flat on its face because it proposes that from viewing / participating from a alternate, chaotic universe you could solve your earthly problems. This is not impressive philosophy but rather bland and flawed and the creators tried to make up for it with some feeble comic elements. Another nuisance was the constant barrage of fast cross cutting and cutaway in and out of parallel universes. This is only done one or 2 times preferably in the 3rd act to tie loose ends to give audiences insight into the character's feelings and thoughts, but here it felt like we are engaged in a video game.

Title: What was this?
Review:
Let me start by saying that I loved all the actors! They really did a magnificent job with the material they had. Frankly, I wish I could see them more often in more movies because they are real good.

I literally do not understand why this movie is considered as "great, amazing and revolutionary". It's really a disjointed story with no plot. Some even called it "eccentric"!, But it really reflects on today's moviegoers attention span to follow a story, or have patience on how it builds up. The way it was edited, it was almost like scrolling through Instagram!

Wait until it streams save your money.

Title: Huh ?
Review:
There were so many accolades and awards for this movie, I was compelled to watch it. I'm actually only 45 minutes in, and I'm forcing myself to keep it on. I guess it's an either love or not love situation. Maybe I'll need to watch it 2 or 3 times. I can't imagine doing that. To illustrate complex personal relationships , life lessons and choices in such a visually discombobulated way, is just exhausting and annoying. An acquired taste I guess, but definitely not mine. Weird. Going to read all the glowing reviews to try to understand what I'm missing.

I do applaud the filmmakers, editors, special effects crew though....would have been as exhausting to make as to watch.

Title: Matrix 2.5
Review:
Take a lifetime of ideas, and a whole lot of money, then fail in so many levels to get it right. This kind of film has been done so much better elsewhere. You see the kernels of good ideas, but they fall flat way too many times. Nice try in doing something that isn't just sequels or marvel movies, but you get the impression that they are desperatley trying to make a movie that will be heralded as the new cult movie for this decade. Set pieces lack the impact you would and should expect of a film with this amount of expectation they have given themselves... a strong 12 ot of 10 for trying too hard.

Title: Just good composition; the ideas aren't theirs.
Review:
The film is entertaining because it is definitely absurd, and it's fun, but it's deeper elements are a composition of other people's ideas. Especially part two. You would think that either Daniel would be able to discuss the origins of the philosophical sentiments expressed in the movie if they were their own... but in any interview, neither can touch on the detail relating the concepts being tied together, not even remotely. But, somehow miraculously, they can present them in film? How is that? Because the ideas aren't Daniels'.

Because of that, I don't see them making another philosophically compelling movie after this. Kwan already admits this in his interviews, and it's likely for good reason.

Title: Everything, Everywhere, Tupperware, we don't care

And no, it doesn't help, just adding meaningless fight sequences.

Those don't even work in Rick and Morty....

Have people become dumber? Watching movies like these certainly makes a case for it.

Hollywood... Stop making multiverse movies if you don't have an original idea, or even a new thought.

Stop trying to please fans. Stop trying to calculate what the fans want, and instead make something you really, HONESTLY, Love......

Title: Ok but a bit nuts
Review:
Some brilliant acting and vivid ideas and this also made me laugh a lot in places. There are some really funny scenes but also quite a bit that could have been left on the cutting room floor.

Its a bit Twin Peaks random in places, which doesn't always work and sometimes is just a bit too crazy for its own good. It's as if a few drunk guys, got a bit more drunk, ate some mushrooms and wrote a movie!

I'd actually recommend watching it, - it's a pretty seminal movie and very different to most things. But be warned, it's not an easy watch and is quite long.

In summary - like nothing you'll watch this year - some brilliant performances and a well crafted movie but be warned it is a couple of sandwiches short of a picnic!

Title: The "Emperor's New Clothes" Strikes Again!
Review:
I have formulated an overview on society today and what it embraces as deep, meaningful and true: the Emperor's New Clothes syndrome. This movie, and the multitude of praise and hype it has garnered, reflects just how shallow, sophmoric and unthinking our society has become. Some of the acting was good, but the pretentious premiss was totally lacking in coherence and credibility. It was, however, a nice assembly of costumes which in themselves might garner an Academy Award, but that would be about it. The amount of time and money put into the brief displays of costuming don't translate into the disjointed undeveloped plot, which boils down to nothing more than a display of bloody martial arts with lots of high-school-boy-humor. Even Michelle Yeoh couldn't transcend those low moments...which are pervasive if you sit back and analyze the proceedings.

I felt no emotional connection with anyone in the film, despite the many tears milked in the hope that the audience would care enough about the characters to buy into them...which apparently a majority of reviewers did (!) Nothing deep or meaningful transpired in this movie...just the Emperor parading naked in front of his bamboozled subjects.

Title: Panic attack, existential crisis, both at the same time
Review:
I can confidently say that this was one of the most insane movie experiences that I have ever been though. The key word here is experience- as it is not a film which you can simply 'watch'.

First things first- I can appreciate this as a great ode to filmmaking and a great example of it- it's a stunning work of visual art which twists every rule about film in a bonkers and entirely unique way.

Yet I simultaneously felt like I was going to combust with pure anxiety while watching it. Strobe effects warning? I think this film needs a heart condition warning. At one Kubrick-esque moment, me and my friend nearly (literally) pissed ourselves laughing. I involuntarily found myself shouting several profanities in pure awe, chaos, disgust and hilarity. This film had my body reacting in ways that I didn't think a film could, which was easily worth the ticket price and the act of watching it.

Towards the end though, I just wanted to get out of the theatre, go to the loo and catch my breath- which I think is both an amazing sign and quite a horrific one. The film's message really didn't hit me- but I don't really mind that it did, and am glad that many people found something within it. Because what I found was one of the most insane film experiences I have ever been subject to.

Now, let's calm down and have a nice cream cheese bagel.

Title: A very bad trip
Review:

Title: Low signal-to-noise ratio
Review:
Tries too hard. It's not as emotionsl as you think, because it never establishes the relationships it thinks it does. Very noisy. A good way to disestablish a relationship is to add noise -visual and aural. Focus. Pare down the story.

Ban multiverse movies due to their low signal-to-noise ratio.

Title: Nothing, nowhere, all over the place!
Review:
This was a frustrating nonsensical seven shades of weird way to spend an evening. The opening scenes are boring and elongated waffle and then the film clumsily transitions into a pseudo wacky tacky kungfu psychedelic mess. The rave 10 out of 10 reviews have a whiff of the Emperor's New Clothes about them. Given the repeated Laundromat scenes you would expect that bad smell to go away but the film gets worse the longer it's allowed to go on. It's not arty it's just odd and poorly put together with crap characterization and zero screenplay. A dull scruffy dull scrappy disjointed nonsense. At the end of my days my Tombstone would read "May have lives a little longer but was robbed of 2 hours of his life back in January 23. Oooof.

Title: Terrible idea
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: Low budget Asian Matrix?
Review:
And low budget meaning - they saved on every possible aspect of a movie - plot, story line, dialogues, acting, consistency, logic, while being generous with fight scenes, ridicoulous costumes and scenery, 'vilians' for sake of having vilians so somebody can fight, you name it.

And it narows down to family relationships and dynamics that could be placed in completely different context and without unnecessary accelerated shots, multivereses (and interesected with slow motion fight scenes).

All in all, it looks like super long SNL skit, and not a funny one.

Title: Confusing
Review:

So far I considered IMDB as a serious source for good movie ratings. I am confused. Not only about the movie but also about my understanding about what makes a good movie. A good story and a nice visual and audible package.

Title: All at once forgettable
Review:
I fell asleep half way through in the cinema... and when I woke up it did not matter how much I had missed. I didn't feel curious as to what I had dozed through because there was no progressive story line to follow. Just a compendium of individually non-essential scenes stitched together - any one of which could have been cut from the movie and we'd be none the wiser. It wasn't so much a plot as it was a premise, and so there was no plot to lose track of.

I feel like a basic dynamic was borrowed from Sense8 - the power to tap into multiple abilities from another dimension to get out of a fix. Even so, there was never any sense that the protagonist was in any real mortal danger.

There were moments of silliness and moments of sobriety that I appreciated... but on the whole, it felt mismatched.

At the end of the movie, I felt cheated: what appeared to be a literal, objective experience could very well have simply been an inner struggle of the protagonist worked out in her imagination.

The villain never once felt like a villain... and one knew from the moment the villain was revealed that they would inevitably have to patch things up by the end of the movie... and so there was no real sense of the villain being truly dangerous or ruthless to the core.

The movie felt predictable and laborsome to watch. I'm not at all fussy and end up loving movies that most tear apart... but this film was forgettable -- they spelled it all out for us and left no mystery to ponder once all was said and done. And even the visual messiness/ madness of the movie was not disturbing or intriguing enough to give me fitful dreams - having gone straight home thereafter and jumped into bed - which I found quite odd. There was nothing truly captivating or gripping about this movie despite the acting being quite decent. No loose ends. Ironically, nothing is left to the imagination.

Title: If I had ADHD this might have been a fun trist.
Review:

I love to watch complicated plots, and the multiverse is very complicated, but this is loud, hard to follow and not fun. The main characters are not likeable, go not give you reason to care about them, or how they end up. Its a long, loud cacophony of screeching birds that cant sing a pretty or harmonious song. I was trying so hard to engage, but it pushed back on me every moment I watched. What a shame, moms rule, but this was a tragic, epic slog.

Title: A bitter pill, but not the healthy kind
Review:
In general I didn't really enjoy this.

The budget Jackie Chan was my favourite.

My overwhelming feeling from this film is that a cautionary tale about being happy with your lot in life and not wishing for greater things would be far more compelling had it not come directly from a company which makes billions of pounds and doesn't have to live by the rules which everyone else does; not to mention it is portrayed by actors who famously are not happy with their lot in life and eternally strive for greater wealth and notoriety.

But what do I know, I'm just an extra.

The initial notion was good, but the storyline was lazy and poorly delivered.

Title: Not bad but nothing really new
Review:
I had high expectations for this film, following on from the Oscars. Having just seen it on Amazon prime I must admit I am a feel a bit let down and puzzled by all the hype. The acting and special effects are good, but I don't think it delivers anything really new beyond what we have seen before. The idea of multiple parallel universes stemming from different decisions taken individually is surely not new. A quick Google of "science fiction multiple universes" throws up a number of references, some quite old and several with (in my opinion) similar story lines.

Maybe I am mistaken and maybe it's just that I have read books with similar story lines and perhaps they just never made it to film versions. I'm thinking of Andre Norton's The Crossroads of Time, Isaac Asimov's The Gods Themselves. Perhaps more obvious film comparisons would be The Matrix series.

I know it's all a very subjective experience, so all I can say is that, for me, it just didn't deliver. I'm sure others will disagree, as is their right, but I would be surprised if I was the only one feeling a little cheated and let down.

Title: Oh please...
Review:

Everyone to decide themselves, I just hope I would not have watched this, as this was the worst movie I have ever seen. And I've seen a lot...

What puzzles me most is that how is it possible so many people give this movie such high ratings. Surely no-one can honestly say this was a great movie? Someone wrote about the emperor's new clothes. If the movie does not make any sense, is painful to watch and lasts forever, it must be great. Well, it is not.

Title: Horrible and overrated
Review:
I disliked this movie pretty much from the start. For a movie trying to get across such an important message, this was just not the right way. It was so long and too complex, not for any real cause, that I found myself begging for it to be over.

I did end up liking the ending, as I like the moral of the story, however, most of the rest of the movie was not necessary, poorly developed, or was super cheesy... I mean, I saw the "villain" from a mile away and even if I didn't, it just can't get any cheesier than that.

I also appreciate that people in the comments liked the chaos in the movie, but for me, I don't need a movie to give me anxiety.

Title: Probably both the best movie and the worst movie I've seen in a long time...
Review:
The Good

I haven't been this gripped by a movie in a long time and I've never seen anything quite like it before. This movie is one of a kind; it's incredibly unique. The production was immaculate and intriguingly strange. Hats off to the director and the actors for making this happen.

The Bad

It could have been little shorter. The movie starts to drag a little bit towards the end but I suppose it makes up for this in the production.

Some people may not like how visual the movie is; I've seen a couple reviews where people called the movie a "visual assault."

The Terrible

This is one of the most morally shallow films I've ever seen. I was left incredibly disappointed by the philosophy that the movie was promoting at the end. It wants us to accept nihilism, because we're all just a tiny speck of dust on one of several planets in a universe among many.

According to the movie, nothing matters and we should do whatever we want to do, but we just have to make sure that we include one important action: "Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on." What???? So nothing matters and we can do whatever we want to do, except that we have to be nice to other people? If nothing matters then what exactly is the point of being nice? There's no reason to do anything in any particular way if we are all just insignificant.

It's as though the movie production was only as immaculate and spectacular as it was just to slyly distract us from the fact that it's promoting nihilism. I think it's reprehensible.

The movie eats itself by trying to pass as "inclusive" while simultaneously calling us all insignificant and irrelevant.

Title: Acting score A+, but D+ for movie
Review:
When the trailers first appeared on television, I had no interest in ever seeing this film. Then I watched the March 12, 2023 Academy Awards show. When any movie manages to appear so universally loved and wins so many prizes during the awards season, I figure it's worth a couple of hours of my time. I tried watching it today, but couldn't get through much more than the first hour so far. Then I looked up the full synopsis online, trying to make some sense of what was happening on the screen. Okay, I now get the gist of the story, but the movie is all over the place. It felt like I was watching a spinning disco ball that was covered in Post-Its, each with a little piece of the story, and then had to try to mentally organize them all into something. All I achieved was a headache and some ice strain.

Title: Disappointed
Review:
Maybe I had very high expectations but I really disappointed.

Many people said that this movie is "funny" but I felt embarrassing 13yo American teenage boy humour.

The "message" of this movie isn't that unique, very basic Too many "action scene" made it boring.

I think people liked it because they can relate to that 'family issues' and maybe that's why they cried. I've seen a lot of reviews that this movie made them cry and I'm a very emotional person but I didn't cry at all.

The movie effects were good tho. Even tho I don't know anything about 'effects', I actually liked it.

Lastly, actors and actresses did very well!

Title: The Matrix fan flick
Review:
Trying too hard to be the Wachowskis by stealing all their ideas, except for bits they lifted from Buckaroo Banzai. Overlong, unoriginal and dumb. It might have been okay as a 90 minute movie, but to pad it out there is repeated scene after repeated scene. An hour in and the plot simply bogs down and never gets going again.

Title: 4 is enough!
Review:
If you have seen more films, you will surely consider the level of this film to be average. The interesting parts of this film were struggles, traveling in a parallel world and comedy.

If I had the ability to make a film like this, I would definitely make the best one. Of the two hours of the film, only thirty minutes were useful, the script was strong and the subject matter of the film was interesting.

The actors played well, but the choice of actors for the roles was awful. In this film, more than showing the art of acting, more technological effects were used and it was very imaginative.

And the best part was the concept of living and being together, which was useful.

Title: Why have I done? why I wasted my time on it?
Review:
It started great. Trailer was also good. IMDB rate was high. I am sort of a busy guy and I barely have time to watch movies, however, after seeing the IMDB rate of this movie, I thought, why not? It's been a while I didn't watch a quality movie so let's give it a shot. The bad thing about me is when I start something, I rather finish it to the end and to top that up, I was so devastated at the end of this movie that I told to myself quiet loudly, what have I done to myself and my time? And why people should give it this rate? Absolutely overrated movie in my opinion, no aim, no sense with mediocre acts. I am being generous to rate it 3 and it's only because of the action scenes. I hope no one else with the same working schedule that I have gone through this misery.

Title: Great destination, horrible journey...
Review:
I have trouble turning off my brain. Anxieties, worries, mundane to-dos, even positive things, sometimes feel like they're swirling around in a chaotic funnel cloud and I would like nothing more than to sit in physical and mental silence.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" felt like the inside of my head. In a world of non-stop, 24/7 news, most of it bad, how is a person like me, who has trouble filtering out things that affect me directly from all of the other things that are just out there happening in general and over which I have no control, supposed to cope?

One answer is to decide that nothing matters anyway and give up caring. But that means deciding that my wife doesn't matter. And that my kids don't matter. And that art, and nature, and things that bring joy to my life, don't matter.

Another way is to decide that some things, ok maybe most things, don't matter, but that there are things that do, and those are the things that make it all worth it. I get to decide what those things are.

The first approach is nihilistic. The second approach is empowering. This film explores both approaches, and I was a sobbing mess at the end.

I will say there were times that I was a bit exhausted by this movie. It throws a lot on the screen and at the viewer, and occasionally it can't keep up with its ambitions. But this was mostly a home run.

Michell Yeoh does terrific work in this, but the MVP is Ke Huy Quan (Short Round from the "Indiana Jones" movies).

Grade: A.

Title: KUNG FU GENRE
Review:
An incredibly long boring heavily hyped Kung Fu movie with lots of special effects. That right there dumbed down any artsy sub text. Very glad we only paid $6.00 to watch it On Demand. Go see Elvis.

Title: Mid Tier at best
Review:
Mid Tier at best

I was waiting for the good part, actually fell asleep the first watch.

Gave it another go and was not any better, i dont know if they were trying to be funny in some scenes and i can usually find humour in most things but they just didnt hit right.

Chaos is the best way to explain this movie, i understand what they were trying to do but the story is garbage, none of the characters draw you in and the ending was garbage.

The movie will probably just leaved you confused, just like i am confused at how this movie has got such good ratings.

B grade movie and actors.

I would definitely give this one a miss, if you have something else to watch.

Title: No, no, no.
Review:
It's like the Matrix but bad. It feels like if someone had a lot of bad dreams after having heavy diners or drugs and spent an awful night full of nonesense dreams and wrote them not even in the order they happened.

It feels like to be nominated for an Academy Award in the last three years you don't have to participate with a good movie anymore. Culturally wrong, with erroneous cultural mistakes, bad acting and to make it even worse, it is boring. I couldn't wait for it to end.

My friends and I came up with funnier stories just to be silly during highschool.

I am glad I didn't pay for my ticket to watch this.

The 4/10 stars I gave it was just because the respect to James Hong.

Title: Everything Too Explained Everywhere All at Once
Review:
Too deep in its own multiverse for its own good.

Even though I consider that the main characters have a very generous development the movie fails to adhere to the "Show don't tell" film mantra. It felt that it needed too much explaining. Other movies with plots as complexed (Inception one of them) required less explanation.

At the end I liked the characters but I believe this story could have been a great sequel to a very good "cliffhangered" movie.

Title: I'm only giving it a 3 because the actors did a wonderful job.
Review:
But everything else was honestly not it for me. I found it confusing, and slow. The first few scenes were a complete mimic of the Matrix when Neo is in the offices being chased at the very start. I found it was really a combination of many of my favourite movies. From the Matrix to Dr Strange to Any SciFi about universe jumping. Though the performances were fantastic, the storyline was too boring for me, or just not good enough ? We didn't get to experience the other people's lives, we didn't get to experience their world and so it was tough feeling the way that the main actress was suppose to be feeling. While easy to feel the doom of the other characters as we could find ourselves in them. To bring hope, they should have shown more of it.

Title: Would probably rate it higher if not for the oscar
Review:
Sure it had its moments, but all in all it was just too much of what it's titled. Good job by the actors, and really cool that to see the guy who played Data in The Goonies and Shorty in the Indiana Jones movies again.

Mostly I think it's sad that a movie like this is even considered to win an Oscar. Not because awards are so important, but because I guess it shows where the arts are headed. Towards quick rewards, political corectness, and everyone gets a medal at the end. I read a review where someone wrote something about it feeling like a big old messy concoction of tik tok clips, wich I found pretty accurate.

Title: A hyperactive mess
Review:
Man, I feel like I must be one of the only people who didn't like this movie. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fitting name for it because that's what this movie throws at you and for me it just didn't work. It's for the most part a tale of finding family across the multiverse which I think could've worked fine on its own. Instead, it's got this scifi "jumping" element where in order to switch multiverses you have to do a "statistically improbable action". So you go from artsy shots and the protagonist discussing divorce with her husband to some guy sitting on a buttplug in an office or a universe where people have fingers made of hotdogs. I only laughed once or twice during the movie; the overall tone wasn't comedic and the "wacky" bits were quite tame compared to what's been done in Rick and Morty to much greater effect. You're also constantly jumping around, martial arts gets thrown in...it's all a bit incoherent.

I would rate Eternal Sunshine higher for emotional time travel, About Time higher for romantic time travel, Rick and Morty higher for comedic time travel, The Butterfly Effect higher for thought-provoking time travel...in summary; this movie is not more than the sum of its parts; it's more like the average of its parts and each part isn't as strong as it could be on its own.

If you like "trippy" movies then this might be for you but if you're looking to stay awake for two hours then I'd find something else to watch.

Title: Overhyped
Review:
This is my first review on IMDB. I couldn't resist. After seeing all the hype and high reviews and the Oscar nomination buzz, I decided to check it out. I managed to get through 45 minutes before I just couldn't take it anymore. I thought it was disjointed and a bunch of nonsense. What are all these critics and reviewers seeing that I'm missing? I watch movies for entertainment and I watch a lot of movies. I might try to watch a bit more to see if I'm missing something, but by 45 minutes in, I would expect to be interested and entertained. So far a waste of time. I guess the lead actors are doing a good job, and Jamie Lee Curtis was certainly in a different role for her, but the story itself needs to make sense.

Title: Less is More..
Review:
Let me start out by saying, I appreciate movies that are different and out of the norm. So I went in with an open mind. From the very first scene I was excited because I found the characters, very interesting and I was very much invested in the main characters struggles with her day to day life, her family, her business and all the crisis she was facing. So I thought I was going to watch a good movie.....and then the whole other scene unfolded at the IRS office and it took me right out of the movie.

I don't think its a bad movie its just that adding all the other elements was completely unnecessary. Where I think doctor Strange worked better is that the alternate universes tied into the movie in a way that made the movie coherent. What they did in this movie doesn't. It just felt like it was a big, pointless mess. They had everything they needed to make a great story without adding all of the other elements.

Had they just went with the story as it was before the alternate universe scenes, the movie could have been something special. With that being said, I do believe the main two characters deserve a nod for their performances. Otherwise, I just did not find this movie to be watchable let alone oscar worthy.

Title: Purposeless chaos
Review:
Aside from good technical compartment, i enjoyed only a few moments in the entire movie.

The beginning is very underwhelming and a lot of characters are a joke.

Some interpretations make me wonder why people work regular Jobs if someone paid for actors to play a part like this and after filming all giving the final "yesss it's good we keep this".

Some comparisons with matrix that i saw really should be deeply thought before placing them close to this movie

And of course since we are in 2022 why don't put in some random "ye we support lgbtq and stuff"?

Very disappointed, and it's a pity because the originality is there, and so the technical prowess.

Title: Narcissist apologia
Review:
Entertaining but off the mark. Written by a person who doesn't understand themself. Narcissism is caused by lack of genuine parental engagement. Resulting in maladjusted psycho sexual development. It's not that your parents don't like that you're gay, it's that you parents are so self absorbed they don't care at all.

The reason I'm being harsh is. Thee conclusion of the movie is actually harmful. It's maladaptive perfectionism which is common in narcissistic abuse. Most of the movie is what would be the reaction of an abused person. Basically a healthy person would reject the premise and not try to save everyone. You're the unibomber and I'm going to have healthy boundaries even if you're my family.

If you don't believe me the multiverse is what happens when you're abused and your psyche implodes because you're regressing in an attempt to cope with the circumstance. You're living in a narcissists false reality and it's very unhealthy. Self improvement is an individual task and you should remove yourself from narcissists. That's healthy behavior. They're sad destructive people that are black holes. Fun movie bad message.

Title: Make sure you can read the subtitles
Review:
I saw this in Mexico, and was unable to read almost all of the subtitled Mandarin dialog as my Spanish is rudimentary. Also the Mandarin accent was heavy and made some of the English dialog hard to understand. For that reason, the movie ideally should be seen with subtitles that the viewer could easily understand.

For this and other reasons, I didn't understand the plot. I kept wanting for it to end so I could leave with the friends I saw it with. Too long for me. One of them said it was fantastic, the other felt the same as I did.

It's a visual spectacle and looks like what one might experience after having done LOTS of acid.
